review: After a a few hours of shopping for Christmas inside the mall, I worked up an appetite and was really craving for something that would satisfy my stomach. It was either Panera, California Pizza Kitchen, or Red Robin. I'm glad I chose Red Robin!  Their bottomless fries and symmetrical art work is everything and a half! Oh, and their Crispy Chicken Sandwich is almost as good as another famous Chicken Sandwich spot I know of.  The staff is so friendly. They were quick to bring out the food and drinks but wasn't on their game about providing utensils and napkins before hand. Had to wait a few bites until I realized I was missing those items. But once I asked them for it, they immediately brought it over in milliseconds. I think the self pay kiosk at the tables is a very clever way to eliminate any billing issues. I know some people are adamant about paying for the things they order and so this kiosk relieves some of that stress and tension.  Overall, good food and a great place to dine and meet up for drinks.

When you really want that good fries fix and have a decent burger along with those fries, Red Robin's the solution. Not too far from home, my wife and I consider RR a treat when we just want to stuff ourselves silly with fries. The burgers are slightly better than just an average burger. Sure, it's good, but it's not amazing. Wife and I always get the tavern burgers as that's the best bang for buck. Reason I gave a 3 rather than 4 or 5 is because it's always a crap shoot when it comes service at this particular RR. We've had some servers seemingly disappear on us for a whole meal service, servers showing partiality in service to other tables based off appearances, and servers that nickle and dime us with charges for items that weren't previously noted that we'd be charged for - so watch out for those random misc charges when you get your check. Pros: Bottomless fries Bottomless strawberry lemonade Nice assortment of complimentary dipping sauces for the fries Cons:  Service could be poor

(huge sigh) I really wanted to like this place. After receiving such great service last time amd tasty burgers and fries I decided to come back. I have returned twice and have been disappointed both times. The service was mediocre. My friend and I sat at the bar area and we received no service. After 15 minutes of just sitting I was ready to walk out, but my friend waved another waiter down who then told us someone would be right with us. We ended up waiting another 10 minutes and a young lady came over and took our orders. We ordered the chili cheese fries (after I warned my friend they aren't good) as well as fries, and fried pickles. We enjoyed everything except the chili cheese fries. We tasted almost no chili. Red Robin should call them cheese fries b/c that's all we tasted. Against my better judgement I came back and ordered the Banzi burger. It was absolutely awful. The pineapple tasted and looked old. There was just a pinch of teriyaki sauce on the burger. I ordered the burger thinking it would taste like the Maui burger at Islands, I was wrong. Oh and service again was reaaaaaaaaaaaaaally slow. It wasn't even crowded. I won't be returning.

We come to this Red Robin quite often. It is conveniently located in the South Bay Galleria mall. We like the burgers and bottomless sides. It's reliably better than Johnny Rockets by a long moon shot.  Hubby and I enjoy the Red Robin Tavern, the guacamole and bacon burger and the Pesto Chicken burger. We also like to personalize our burgers with ciabatta bread and fresh jalapeños.  The kids meals are great deals! My toddlers love these meals. About $4.50-$6.00 for an entree (cod fritter, chicken tender, grilled chicken breast, meatballs, pizza, mac n cheese...), a bottomless side (fries, broccoli, corn, apples, fruit medley...) and a drink (milk, chocolate milk, lemonade, fountain drink). Serving size seems good enough for a 9-10 year old, as long as they get a refill or two on the bottomless size. A 12 year old may still be hungry with these portion sizes.  Given how much we love this place, why not a 5-star review? Service is spotty. Bottomless sides are not refilled all that frequently- seems the restaurant is chronically understaffed with just one waitress for a dozen tables. Also, some of the patrons are on the Ghetto size - I get that this is just the demographics of this mall but it sometimes makes eating here uncomfortable.  The Red Robin Rewards program provides coupons and frequent diners free burgers (10th burger free). Plus, a free burger on your birthday.  South Bay Galleria Mall gift cards also accepted here!

Tavern Tuesdays and free birthday burgers, yay!  And bottomless steak fries too.  Beyond that, I don't have much more to give more than three stars to.  First, I am not a carnivore so, I have depended on my sweetie's opinions on the tavern burger.  We are on the email list so, we get the alerts whenever there is a free burger avaliable at Red Robin. From the photo, the Tavern burger looks pretty good and I was informed how great a burger it is.  For me, all I'm able to have as far as burgers go, is the veggie burger.  I can get any version burger with a veggie patty.  I usually go with something like bbq or something  with a flavorful sauce otherwise regular condiments on a veggie patty is quite bland as their veggie patties are just OK. Love the bottomless steak fries!  Can't complain. Service is hit or miss.  It's a corporate mall chain burger joint so, just a 3 star review for my 1 to 2 visits a year.

Got my free birthday burger here! I don't remember this place the same as dreamy as I did in college, guess my standards have changed. I do love the booth seating and the online iPad ordering. The burgers are not juicy though or as large as those gourmet burgers, it's a step above an average burger you could make yourself at home. The steak fries are alright too, maybe adding the garlic is necessary for a $1.50 extra. I like this place since it's a good deal and it's great to bring kids and you can stay for hours and chat but that's about it. Also, our waitress wasn't as bad as others have quoted as the service being terrible, thought service was pretty good.
I toyed this restaurant before and service is as slow as the turtles and sucks the employees don't have any shame

I had the bruscheta chicken sandwich and it was absolutely perfect. Really delicious, I would highly recommend it. Plus Red Robin always has unlimited fries which is always nice :) My friend had the veggie burger and she said it was really tasty. We both walked away satisfied and happy with our meals.

This is my go to Burger restaurant! Staff is always friendly, funny and bubbly. Love their burgers & bottomless steak fries with their special season salt. Great options- veggie or turkey burgers and chicken sandwiches. Great place to have birthday dinners - sign up for their Rewards club to get a free birthday burger during your birthday month. There was only 1 time I wasn't satisfied with the food - the poutine fries were a little disappointing - too salty and the cheese looked like it was just melted sliced cheese. Other than that everything else I've had was delicious! No maybe it isn't the fanciest place but it's comfy, fun and laid-back with good food, good deals and good drinks. Can't go wrong!

I see where this place can get its bad reviews. It was a hit or miss with us. Our first waiter was not pleasent. But apparently he was on the way out. Got a replacement lady. Super helpful and very caring.  Got two burgers and kids chicken tenders.  Fire Burger thing was good. I got it with chicken and it had the Chipotle flavor. Not spicy at all.  so don't be afraid of it. Was good. Not memorable to say. But satisfies the hunger.  Salmon Burger was GREAT. Deff something I'd get again if I ever came back. Not dry Salmon. Perfectly cooked and very flavorful. Makes you feel like you don't want it to end.  Endless fries are nice. Not a big fan of them but the kids liked them. Chicken tenders were dry. Kids had a hard time chewing them. So that didnt get finished.  Besides that we were offered more fries.  But we can't because we were so full.   Never ending Rootbeer Float is a must if you like it. I do! Hard time transfering root beer into the ice cream mug. But it got easier with a less full cup.  Bathrooms were ok and unbussed tables. Meh. Enoy and Stay Wild!

I stopped by with my friends and family on Christmas Eve and was pleasantly surprised at how good the service was. Our server was Jerrell and he was very attentive, polite and friendly the whole time we were there. He made sure to stop by every few minutes to be sure we were okay and was quick to refill our beverages. All our food was very good, we ordered the ensenada chicken plate, soup & salad, simply grilled chicken salad and the BLTA sandwich and they were all good as was our cinnamon donuts tower dessert.

Red Robin likely gets a bad rep for being a chain restaurant at a time when chains are looked down upon.  However, like many chains currently, they have been doing a good job of trying to offer customers a strong value for what they get.  The bottomless fries (as well as a few other items which are offered bottomless) and reasonably priced burger offerings are what brought me into Red Robin on this trip.  On top of that, management does a good job of sending out frequent coupons through their rewards program.  The tavern burgers offer a nice variety of options at a competitive price, while there are larger, more premium burgers also available. If you sit at the bar, service is pretty reliable and friendly.  The milkshakes are tasty, the beer selection impressive, and you can watch a game while you eat should you choose.  All in all, a good experience at a good price.

Great burgers and bottomless fries! I always pass by this place when going to shop. Decided to give it a go. There's mini touch screens at every table and it includes games for your kids which has a small fee as well as being able to pay right there with card. There is a waiting queue but we only waited 5 min to be seated during the rush which made me quite pleased. I never went to red robins in my whole life but here we go~ A m b i a n c e: I love the classic interior of the place. Walls decorated with classic 20th century portraits and pictures. This place is great for a group because its pretty spacious. There is a bar as well with TV playing the usual sports channel. S e r v i c e: We were served by 3 different waiters and I can see the difference between them. The lady taking our order looked like she didn't want to come to work. Not very welcoming but just taking our order fast and not saying much else. Next guy came along and he hurriedly delivered my baja nachos and sped off without saying a word. The last guy was very attentive. Refilled our waters, and even checked up on us to see how we were doing. I guess its like Russian roulette. F o o d: My chicken burger came in undone, like the bun and veggies were all taken out and laid all on the plate. I guess this is how they do it? Not sure but I had fun putting together the burger. Baja nachos were okay, and I also love their unlimited fries. Cripsy and delish. Burgers was pretty good 7.5/10 P r i c e: Its a bit pricey. Most likely be spending above 10 dollars for their burgers. (I can buy multiple in-n out with that money)

Food: 4/5 for chain casual  Service: 4/5 Khali (sp) at the bar was on it  Value: 5/5 unlimited fries Love coming here during my birth month for the free burger and unlimited steak fries :P Since I have a self proclaimed "black belt in French fries" I'll go on record and say islands unlimited fries don't even compare to Red Robin! Now I'm a little biased because I like my fries with meat (steak cut/wedges) over skinny (shoe string). Their unlimited steak fries are an excellent value!  Burgers are fresh & juicy and fairly priced. When you think about it, Red Robin might be one of the best burger restaurants as far as value, RIGHT NOW!  We've been to this location the past (2) Julys and left happy (full) each time. Mac and cheese burger was solid (not that much pasta on it as the photo). You can't go wrong with any burger just choose based on what you're craving. The vegetarian boca burger is also tasty.  Only negative is sometimes it takes a while to get greeted when you sit in the bar. We moved to the bar stools and received excellent service! Will be back :)

This review is for grub hub delivery which I used for the first time never again , I go here every week for fish n chips and wings delivery driver great, fish and chips would not let me order without ordering a side I ordered side salad I got fish and side salad ...? Grub hub refunded fries for $2.00 if I wanted fish and salad I would have ordered from a fish restaurant first and last time with grub hub I also did not get dips I ordered they were on grub hub order but not on Red Robin order .Red robin would be better just using other delivery service

HAPPY hour is on selected draft beer only. I tried the margarita. .it's full of ice and more juice...  The only thing I like is the bottomless garlic fries. The burger is yummy. .flavored  service is good when it's slow..

Service , Price, Food and atmosphere is great!  Rosie was our server and she was fantastic! She really accommodated us with customizing our order, kept the bottomless fries flowing continuously , I love not having to ask for a refill because your glass is always full.  The prices is extremely affordable!! My tab was 7 bucks for a delicious garment burger and bottomless fries (you can't find that no where) I ordered the Mac N Cheese burger which was absolutely delicious , if you like Mac n Cheese you definitely have to try it ! The fries is delicious very hot and especially fodn of the different sauces and seasoning options. I read the other reviews but I decided to try this location for myself had a very pleasant visit and will visit this location again whenever I'm in the area.

Tues evening burger date with my guy and we landed here. Burgers arent my go to meal, but when I have one it better be good.  Customer service was great. Waiter was attentive and had a sense of humor. The manager walked around tables to make sure  service was good. I ordered  the mushroom and swiss burger and it was good not the best Ive had, but decent. Meat was of okay grade. The sauteed mushrooms were delish and made the burger sooo good. The fries are bottomless and I wasnt excited. They give you a small amount of fries on the refill which will having you requesting a refill about 6 times for two people. Yep, we were given one basket of a small amount of fries to share between the two of us.  The fries didnt taste fresh, more so like a frozen bag of fries. They have different types of sauces for the fries  which is good and made the fries easy to eat.  The sauces cost so just be aware and dont go sauce crazy.  I will visit here again. The burger wasnt bad and my guy is so in love with fries he can eat anybodys fries, so the bottomless fry idea is perfect for him.

Wow, all I can say.  I use to go to Red Robin in Calabases all the time as a kid and all I ever ordered was the Chicken Strips.  They were by far the best in town at the time. I just recently starting going to Red Robin as one opened up near my house after I moved to the South Bay and man, those new burgers, endless fries, service, everything across the board were delicious.  I have been probably 5 times since my first initially visit about a year ago and every time I am stunned by not just the price, but the quality.  I recently wrote a bad review about "Islands" as they are just night and day different in quality. Favorites in no particular order 1.  Bleu Ribbon  OR the Black & Blue (which is slightly better) 2. Whiskey River 3. Smoke & Pepper 5. Mushroom Burger 6.  Even the Crispy Arctic Cod is good! I honestly only get Burgers/ Sandwhiches from this place but I would assume most things are as equally delicious.  Honestly, I haven't really had anything I dont like.  The only downside is the stomach ache after you get from the Bottomless Fries, which you can swap out for any other kind once you finish your first bottomless fries.  Love the atmosphere, and the fast service.  5 stars.  Keep it up Red Robin!

We stopped here for lunch while doing some holiday shopping. At first I was worried that we would have a long wait for a table because it was a very busy time of year and the restaurant looked pretty full, but we were seated in under 10 minutes. Their menu is great; standard American fare, fun appetizers and burgers, chicken, some fish, etc. so there is something for everyone. We had the tower of onion ring appetizer (best onion rings I've ever had, no joke) and then we all got something different for lunch. Everything was delicious, our server brought our meals out quickly and was attentive even though it was busy. Service and food both excellent. Red Robin never disappoints.

I got the BBQ Boss Hog burger. The pulled pork bbq wasn't pulled enough for my liking. It was in one big clump, not spread across the burger evenly. The bbq sauce was nice and sweet though. The burger was well done but still juicy. The jalapeño kaiser roll tasted nothing like jalapeño. The onion straws I got on the side were wet and limp, not crispy. They did give me new ones which were better. Our server was Rosie. She was nice and attentive. The restaurant is clean, large, always busy, and has lots of glass windows.

You would think that a restaurant like this would be poppin during dinner hours, especially on the weekends. NOPE! This place is surprisingly not that busy. I honestly don't love their burgers but I like coming here when I feel like I have to go to a sit-down restaurant that's not too pricey but that's also not too crowded and busy.  "Are you looking for AMAZING burgers?" This is not the place. I'm sure Red Robins had a time when it was popular for their "gourmet" burgers, but honestly there are just too many burger joints these days they're competing against. You can definitely find a better place that's not a nationwide chain restaurant.  "Are you looking for ENDLESS fries?" This is the place! Red Robins is known for their "bottomless" fries. Order your burger and ask to start off with some fries, order more if you have to (while you wait for your burger), then your burger will come out with fries, and then you're free to keep ordering more! Don't forget to ask for dipping sauces! My personal favorites: Bleu cheese and honey mustard! **EXTRA** If you're willing to spend the money, try their "Freckled Lemonade"!

Took my grand daughter here for her birthday and I honestly couldn't run out of there fast enough my husband had a long black curly hair in his food on top of that we saw the waitress one time ! This place has the worse customer service and always have but I understand things get busy kept giving them chances BUT now hair in their food !!? I WILL NEVER EVER EVER RETURN TO Red Robin again ! I paid through their little table kiosk thing and took off ! There service on top of hair in the food made this a awful experience I didn't even bother to tell them to sing happy birthday very disappointed but I know now to never come back .

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Best costumer service I had  here I place a order online and it was the quickest!!!! Love their employees they are so nice and very profesional  I think I might want to start coming more often and eat here!!!!!!! A five star restaurant

Been here twice so far, and both were good experiences. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the food is here. I'm a vegetarian, so going to a burger place can be pretty scary. They have quite a few vegetarian friendly options, but my favorite is the siracha tavern burger with the Boca burger patty!  The last time I was here I ordered this new burger- it has spicy aoli, onion rings, cheddar cheese, pickles, lettuce and tomatoes. It was SO good, and paired perfectly with the yummy thick cut fries and Mich Ultra. They sent out the burger frozen, but quickly brought back a fresh, perfectly cooked one as soon as it was brought to their attention. My boyfriend loves the mac and cheese burger, unlimited fries, and all of the sauces. The onion rings are also pretty bomb. Definitely can't go there too often due to not wanting to kill my insides, but it's a nice treat every once in awhile.  I'll be back!

Whenever my sister and I take our dogs to the groomers, we always stop by Red Robin for lunch and then shopping. The quality isn't as good as I remember, or maybe its just this location or... maybe I just chose the wrong burger but today's visit left me thinking that I shouldn't go to Red Robin anymore. My sister and I arrived at noon and were promptly seated by the host on their "patio" which is actually in the mall. Our server, Shannell was great. Super attentive, quick to ask us if we wanted fries and drink refills and was very friendly. Even though she got a bunch of tables back to back (and 2 large parties too), she still managed to give us great service.  I always get the freckled lemonade ($4.99), free refills! It wasn't very sour today and seemed a bit watered down IMO. My sister thought it was ok though.  - Bleu ribbon burger: tomatoes, lettuce, patty and blue cheese with a chipotle sauce I believe. I love blue cheese so I thought it would be a good choice but I was a bit disappointed when it came out. The buns weren't your traditional bun, and I think I was distracted by the blue cheese because I didn't notice that on the menu, it said onion bun! My burger was cold and the bun wasn't toasted. It wasn't very appetizing. I'm not sure if it was left to sit out while waiting for the fresh batch of fries to come out. My fries were also decent. I thought they could have stayed in the fryer for a tad bit longer.  - Fish and chips $13.49. 4 medium pieces of battered fish on top of a lettuce garnish and served with some tartar sauce and lemon. It came with bottomeless fries but my sister opted out for mac n cheese for $1.49 more. She really enjoyed the mac n cheese and thought the fish was just ok. Not the best she's had according to her.  Our server eventually got super busy, but I think a manager came by our table to ask us if we needed anything else. We requested a box. The cool thing is that you can pay at your table using the ipads they have on the table. Its similar to outback, applebees and other restaurants now a days. Make sure to complete a survey if you were satisfied with your experience! It would help the server a lot!

The Service: Slow.... not too attentive, server is taking care too many tables.  The Food: Love the kids menu. Many varieties to choose from. Love the bottomless side dish and drinks!! They have free balloons in the lobby and on the kids menu there are games they can play while they are waiting for their food.  Now they have ipad type of the screen on each table so you can order from there. There are also games too. Each game cost $1.99 and you don't need to swipe the credit card to play, they charge you on the bill. So watch your kids when they touch the ipad because you don't want any surprise charges on your bill.  The Parking: Mall Parking lot.... super super super challenging to find a spot!!

Food actually was good I had the black and bleu burger and it was cooked to my liking. Although it didn't have a lot of seasoning there is the house seasoning on the table to indulge. Fries hot and fresh onion ring tower was good. Only complaint if you order the bottomless fries you should actually receive unlimited amounts we didn't. So I would actually give the food 4 stars for the quality. For me it's very pricey for burgers and fries $45 for two people is a bit much and this would be my only deterrent for not frequenting the joint.  Service really needs some help there should be someone at the wait desk when you walk in or else why have there? Server was a bit slow on the refill jump but I guess maybe because it was a Saturday night. Update... Recently revisited had the same thing and it did not tastes the same burger was flavorless cold fries. The service is horrible slow uninviting and for some reason the place just feels dirty and sticky. Needless to say I won't be back.

Yelp 2017 100 Challenge: 2017 Review 78/100 As an avid patron of Red Robins in the east coast, I am always a frequent customer of Red Robins. It was my first time at this location due to nearby work, and surprisingly, this location was the best that I had been to in Los Angeles. I usually only go to the one at Glendale Galleria, but this location served my burger quickly and fresh with great service! It was one of the first times I've felt that the burger melted in my mouth because it was served so quickly after being cooked. The service was great and I just wish I lived nearby so I could visit this location more often.  Note: Parking is free and abundant as it is part of the mall.
Had really good burgers and fries. Sara J our server was very attentive. We were very happy.

4 stars for a red robin?  yep! I usually come here to watch NBA games (go dubs!) at the bar area, the service is always great and they are great with the fries refills! I've gotten all sorts of burgers (including the cod burger) and a few salads and all are great! There is a bit of a wait at times so make sure you put your name down early if you have a larger party.
Marvelous restaurant that never fails to impress me. Tasty food and exquisite cuisine. Delicious gourmet burgers always and forever.

Unbelievable! Virtually empty & we are still waiting to be seated! 3 girls folding menus, waiters just walking around clueless. The only reason we're here is because my son likes it here. Will do my best to convince him otherwise. BTW - this was the Redondo Beach location in the Galleria. When we finally got a waitress to get our order (after saying she'd be right there three times), my son ordered a milkshake only to be told they didn't have any ice cream.  We walked out. 30 minutes wasted.

WORST. SERVICE. EVER.  Our party of 12 waited for 30 minutes to be seated - which was fine.  When we were seated, our waitress Bree, stood at the computer for 15 minutes while we waited.  She finally came to take our drink and food order BUT took her time to do everything.  Every time we looked for her, she was standing at the computer.  Either she needs better training or she should not be serving parties over 4.   Half of our party was served their food and then the other half came 20 minutes later.    I will NEVER come to this location EVER again.

So unorganized! Our waitress was very sweet, but she was working practically alone. You know how frustrating it is to see employees sit down for their break and they get their food before you? Our appetizers were messed up but they did correct that before we even noticed. The apps came out with the entrees and we were so hungry by the time the food came, we didn't care. The BBQ chicken wrap used to be my "go to" item at Red Robin. It's no where near as tasty as it used to be. The mai tai I ordered, was the highlight of my meal. I should've just went to Islands next door.

I took my son and my girlfriend here on Saturday night just to get out of the house and to redeem my free birthday burger.  We were greeted very warmly by the staff and were seated within 3 minutes of arriving.  Our waitress, Jessica I believe her name was, was very friendly and attentive to our table.  I ordered a southern barbecue burger and garlic fries and was quite pleased with the meat as well as the sauce and topping.  Everything was fresh, tasty and flavorful.  My girlfriend ordered a turkey burger and fries and my son ordered a grilled cheese with multiple servings of broccoli.  I ordered a couple of margaritas and Long Islands that night to wash down that wonderful burger.  My son topped his dinner off with a milkshake.  Although we were only inside eating briefly and they were about to close soon, everyone had a warm personality and seemed to love working there.

I love the food at Red Robin but have serious issues with how servers are treated when customers don't pay their bill and cheap people complain about their food so Red Robin will give them free food  All this poor cheap customers goes on record of servers who only did their jobs It's very sad that Red Robin doesn't have policy to protect the servers being shamed from false complaints from lying customers

I've gone back twice, but made sure to eat there. We're keto now and they actually offer a lettuce-wrapped burger on the menu. It's actually pretty good! I get it with a side salad to keep the carbs low. It still seemed a bit too busy for the number of servers, with a manager having to step in and help out, but it's much better than the Riverside location we used to frequent.

This was absolutely my worse experience I have ever had at any restaurant ever. Our waitress was ver nice and hard working but it took about 50 minutes if not longer for us to get our food and appetizers; and one item did not come out at all. It is very bad when paying customers are waiting for food and workers come out on break and have their food.  The managers even came out an met with each other while we were waiting for our food.  We were in the patio area because we had our puppy with us; all together there were approximately six tables in use and four were near the end of their meals.  I am not sure if more coverage was needed for that area or if our server was simply overwhelmed.  I am a rewards card member and I do not know if I will be back any time soon; I am writing this review in hopes the wait time will be improved for other patrons.  Also, a manager did come and apologize for the appetizer problem.

My co-worker brought me an order of fish and chips. Limited amount of fries, the fish needed some seasoning but was good enough. No coleslaw in the box and I love coleslaw! Just one piece of ugly wilted lettuce. We have eaten at the restaurant and the same item was delicious. No more take out from Red Robin for me.

PERHAPS THE WORST MANAGED RESTAURANT I HAVE EVER BEEN TO!  While the food is usually OK I usually avoid this place due to our prior experiences there.  However, they are having a free milkshake promotion so my son really wanted to go. While the restaurant had dozens of empty tables we were told there was a wait and left our name. We waited while 3 greeters stood there folding menus and a manager wandered around. We were finally seated. We looked at the menu and waited to order. And waited and waited. The waitress finally came by 3 different times to say she'd be right with us. While we continued to wait we watched her standing in the bar watching a basketball game on TV. Finally she came over to take our drink order. Naturally my son ordered a milkshake. The response, "oh we're out of ice cream."  Really, you are running a free milkshake promotion and you are out of ice cream?!?!  We left. Inexcusably slow and poor service given the number of empty tables and the number of employees standing around. Obviously HORRIBLE management!!  We just left and we will not be back!

This is our favorite burger place. Of course we have to get the endless steak fries with the special seasoning. Ricardo was the best server ever, refilling our drinks and fries with friendly efficiency. Can't wait to go back!
I always have a great experience here with the employees I receive tremendous customer service and my food is always fast and fresh !
Horrible service. Waiting more than 30 minutes. According front desk. They were short of people. No customer service. Staff need more training. Never come again.

Terrible service. We waited half an hour after we got our seats for a server to come and when that never happened the manager on duty began walking around. She prioritized some tables and completely SKIPPED outs and just walked by trying to avoid eye contact. She managed to apologize to all the other customers but if she were actually sorry maybe she could have brought out drinks while walking around and did something. I've been to a lot of red robins, sadly, but this is definitely the WORST SERVICE I have ever had.  Put someone in charge that knows how to provide customer service.

I enjoy Red Robin's food every time I go. I love that they have bottomless fries and a pretty full bar. The service at this location can be a bit shaken though. Sometimes you get the feeling that they've forgotten about you. I'm not gonna hold it against them to bad because I'm sure being a server is hard enough without me giving them a a hard time. This location is in the South Bay Galleria so you can eat and shop, or shop and eat.

What has happened to good customer service ?  I wish I could give this place 0 stars! The customer service was horrible.  Our waitress ...I believe her name was Christina was very rude and unprofessional... Clearly customer service is not this restaurants priority. The family sitting next to us was clearly very unhappy with the service as well. Waited 15 minutes for a to go box. My husbands Asked for BBQ sauce for his burger.. Not 1 not 2 but 3 times ... Finally they lady brought the bbq sauce by this time my husband was done with his meal..No apology just eye rolling from the waitress is what we received.  I will NOT be returning to this location again . Reeeeed Robin ... yummmmmm. When I was in Hawaii, I would always see the Red Robin commercials on TV and want to go there even more, simply because there are no Red Robins in Hawaii.   But ever since I moved to California, I think I've been to Red Robin enough times to figure out my tried-and-true favorites. Even if I'm not a diehard burger fan, there's plenty on the Red Robin menu to choose from. One of my favorite entrees I ever got from Red Robin was discontinued--a full-sized entrée of creamy Mac & Cheese--but there are still a lot of menu offerings that I do like.   Of course, there will usually some sort of featured burger/promotion when you go to Red Robin, based on the time of year you are visiting or the different current events (sports events, etc.). But here are some of my favorites from the Red Robin menu:   "Crispy Chicken Tender Salad": This is my usual order whenever I go to Red Robin. This salad features a classic lettuce mix tossed with hard-boiled eggs, hardwood-smoked bacon, tomatoes and Cheddar, as well as chunks of Red Robin's classic "Crispy Chicken Tenders." The chicken tenders totally make this salad. There's a good amount of chicken that comes with the salad, and the dish is served with two pieces of garlic focaccia bread (especially amazing when they're warm) and your choice of dressing. While the honey mustard dressing is especially popular, I usually go for the blue cheese. This is probably one of my favorite salad entrees at a restaurant.    "Smoke & Pepper": This gourmet burger is one of the more recent additions to the Red Robin menu and is part of the eatery's recently launched "Finest Gourmet Burgers" line. This creation features a hamburger patty topped with black pepper bacon and extra sharp Cheddar cheese in between slices of a toasted ciabatta bun. The sandwich is served with the eatery's house-made Smoke & Pepper ketchup (which I opted to have on the side). I tried this burger when it first debuted and I was not disappointed with the creation. Basically, with this line of "Finest" burgers, Red Robin is upping the ante and creating more "gourmet" sandwiches. I loved the smoky, peppery flavor of this entrée, and it wasn't too spicy for me to handle. It tasted just fine without the ketchup, and a side of steak fries accompanied the burger, in true Red Robin fashion.   "Bruschetta Chicken": I've only tried this "Bruschetta Chicken" sandwich once, but I absolutely loved the pesto aioli. This dish is complete with grilled chicken breast topped with fresh bruschetta salsa, pesto aioli, Provolone, romaine lettuce and balsamic cream on rustic ciabatta bread. I ordered my sandwich with the salsa on the side, but the other flavors blended together perfectly. The chicken was tender, and the pesto-cheese blend was amazing, with the crunchy ciabatta to top it off.   "Arctic Cod Fish & Chips": I'm always on the hunt for a good fish 'n chips, and Red Robin's version doesn't disappoint. The eatery's version of this dish features premium hand-battered cod fillets that are fried to crispy perfection and served with bottomless steak fries. It's served with dill'd & pickle'd tartar sauce, and you can also use malt vinegar for additional flavor. If I don't feel like eating my usual salad or one of the chicken sandwiches, this entrée is my go-to.   "Mac N' Cheese": Though this is no longer an entrée (much to my dismay), you can still get the "Mac N' Cheese" as a side, and it also accompanies the "Riblets & Mac N' Cheese" entrée. I love this version of mac 'n cheese because it's classic yet incredibly creamy, featuring a cheesy blend of soft noodles.   "Mountain High Mudd Pie": I only had this dessert once, but boy, was it phenomenal. If you're an ice cream lover, then this is for you. The "Mountain High Mudd Pie" features piles of chocolate and vanilla ice cream layered with fudge, caramel and OREO cookies. I always get this dessert sans whipped cream because it has plenty of sweetness on its own. I love the combination of the OREO cookie crust, topped with the luscious ice cream and drizzled with the sticky caramel and fudge.   "Gooey Chocolate Brownie Cake": Though I can't say this "Molten" dessert is better than the one at Chili's, it's still a good sweet option to finish off your meal. This moist, indulgent chocolate brownie cake is topped with vanilla ice cream and hot fudge and is served with sweet strawberries and a berry sauce. The last time I had this brownie cake, there were a bit too many strawberries/too much berry sauce for my liking, as the sauce was a bit tart. But I love the texture of the fudgy brownie cake, and when combined with the vanilla ice cream and hot fudge, it's heaven on earth.

Red Robins is not that great. I would not recommend trying them out to anyone who asks. The only highlight was the fries, but for a restaurant that boasts that their burgers are the best, this one was very dry and tasteless. I expected much more and was left with this appointment. I will not be going there anytime soon.

The quality of the burgers were good, but not a whole lot better than some of the fast food burgers like Burger King, McDonald's but may be more on par with the cooked when ordered counter service places like In N Out, The Habit, Fatburger and 5 Guys. The average meal or entree is about $10 and if you get a drink, add in tax and tip and you're at around $20 per person.  If you go a bit deeper with appetizers and/or fancier desert drinks, you'll land around $25 per person. I think the prices could go down a notch.  It's less about the portions in terms of their bottomless french fries (or the healither fresh fruit option) and the burger itself, but the patties should be a bit thicker (I'm not sure if the patties are made by a pressing machine or previously frozen but they're reminiscent of Burger King, which isn't bad, but here there's a gourmet price tag 3x+ higher than their fast food peer), and also enable customers to have them cooked to order (i.e., medium rare as opposed to medium well, their default) to get a truly fresh tasting juicy hamburger, so maybe the quality can be taken up a notch.  I'd say the unique ingredients and different named burgers is nice, but the foundation of the hamburger, the beef patty needs maybe a little more TLC in their approach to the perfect burger. I've been going to Red Robin  once in a while since the 1990's, and did notice the re-branding of the restaurant as "Gourmet Burgers" and I know it's been 25+ years with inflation and overhead (employee minimum wage increases too), so can't expect them to be too low, but I think maybe making the burger a bit more remarkable for the price is the solution.   Or have some sort of pre-priced menu with a meal for 2 for $15 (Any 2 burgers w/ bottomless fries) total w/ a soft drink could be a good marketing strategy. I think I felt maybe I could get more or from my perspective better value (be it quality or quantity) for my money, or paid less elsewhere for the same. The service here was fast and friendly as well as attentive. Parking was easy in the South Bay Galleria shopping center mall.  This is in the wing near what now used to be Nordstroms on the Hawthorne Blvd/Artesia (Redondo Beach Blvd) side/corner.
