The manager and Brittany left such a pleasant experience! I know we came in right before they were closing so they were tired but they still assured amazing service. The manager was sure to make sure my problem was resolved, and was so caring and genuine. Will gladly return!

Came in around 8:30pm This rating is purely on the service we received tonight. Hostess was friendly and seated us right away. Our server was no where to be found or the first 15 mins. We flagged down a nearby server and even though we were not in her area, she took the order for us anyways. So thank you Cynthia for doing that. You were very kind for doing that. Our main servee Elise finally came back 30 mins into being seated with mine and my husbands drinks. She told us that our kids shakes would come shortly. Everyone else in the back of the house and Cynthia started to bring out our food fairly quickly. Elise came back a couple of times asked us if we wanted refills and never came back with it. Kids didnt get their shakes until the end of the meal... And only because we told Elise she forgot them. The people that went out of their way to make up for our servers lack of service, we thank you. Elise, we saw how attentive you were with your other patrons, and we are sure that had you actually helped us we would have liked you.. But because you made us sit there for so long while you were MIA and had everyone else cover for you, shame on you. For you we give a 1 star, but because everyone else was amazing and went above and beyond we wanted to leave the review based on them. One bad server could ruin a persons dinner, but thankfully you have great colleagues that stepped in when they saw our faces.
I really like this place in comparison to other chain restaurants that serve food and alcohol.
Great Service on Thursday Night ! Tell me what do you with the food, which is not serviced. There a few Veteans that have gone without.  Let's know !

Once again, I was immensely disappointed with the service, though the food was delicious. I had to change out my water 3 times because there was food debris in each glass, including the third one, until I just decided to get a strawberry lemonade and push the water glasses to the side. Our server had to be asked multiple times for napkins, refills, and utensils before we got them and each time she made us feel like we were a burden for even asking. She made it seem like we were doing her an immense injustice by asking her for the basics, which she should have provided from the start! I was so annoyed by this that I decided not to get dessert so I could head out faster with my family. We ended up eating desserts at DQ in the food court upstairs where, despite the line, we were served quickly and with a friendly attitude.  Sad to say we got better treatment from a fast food joint than this "gourmet burger" restaurant. I'll be back for the Royal Red Robin, but definitely TO GO to avoid your waiting staff.

If this was the Red Robin from 5 years ago, this would be five stars. Watching this Red Robin going from my favorite to let's not eat here is pretty sad. I ordered baked mac and cheese, and it took them 3 tries to get it right. First one was frozen still. Second one was frozen in the middle. Third one was burnt. At least, the burger was somewhat decent. The garlic  fries were greasy. The regular fries were dry and had an unpleasant after taste. I paid and went to Denny's to have an actual meal.

Red robin, yum! I've been to many different red robin locations and for a chain restaurant, it's not too shabby. They are all pretty much standard, a bunch of red and bunch of random frames and trinkets all over the place. The atmosphere is okay, depends on the day and the crowd, but I usually have a good experience at red robin, any that I go to. My GO TO pick is definitely the reds tavern burger, pig out style! Aka bacon and bacon aioli! It's just the right portion size, not too big and not too small; I mean with unlimited steak fries how could you go wrong with it?! Don't forget to ask for honey mustard to dip it in, yum!  Tasty, affordable, chain restaurant, why not.  Happy eats, loves! ^_^

I grew up going with my parents every weekend. I don't know what happened to this place over the years. I would usually get a burger or a chicken sandwich and gorge on their fries. We loved coming here. Recently I have been visiting with my MIL and the food has been either over seasoned or super bland. The service is still nice but I can tell that It isn't as busy as it was 10 years ago. I finally found something on the menu (chicken strip salad) that is flavorful but doesn't upset my stomach. I wish the parking at the mall wasn't so terrible. Be prepared for a long walk back on a full stomach to your car.

I am only giving two stars because I had the worst waitress ever! I believe her name was Katie, she needs serious training. I was there this past Friday night and it was not crowded. However she continued to say she would be back. First it was just the menu which took at least 15 mins to get,  then she said she would be back with the drinks, that took 15 mins  and then when we asked for a refill on chips for an appetizer that took over 15 mins. we were constantly were looking for her. She wasn't managing that many tables. Please get her proper training.

So we decided to come back here and see if the service changed. Still hasn't gotten better and now it seems that corporate decided to change their salad size. WHY OH WHY. I mean seriously without even asking their guest they made the portion so small 4 bites of their now mixed green salad and i was done. First off they took away the iceberg lettuce and changed it to mixed greens. Then they make the portion small!! Also the price is still the same. I'm done with Red Robin. I'm sad to say this but I'm no longer giving them my service.
Red Robin is a family favorite, all 4 of my children have their goto menu items & we have never been disappointed. 10 stars ;-)

Corporate food.  It's predictable, familiar and for the most part satisfies your hunger. This is a popular spot; prices aren't exorbitant so families with all ages of children, young couples and seniors too can dine here and not break the bank. No surprise really that this evening had a decent crowd. Ray greeted us with a smile and friendly demeanor. Took our order and within minutes out came the food. Of the food that arrived, only a quarter of it was a-okay, my burger. Her guacamole burger arrived with very little guac. Our extra crispy fries were limp and we could tell we're not fresh (we both like 'em well done). Ray offered to get us more, 2nd round was about a 3 on a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the crisp that we like. Again the fries were lukewarm at best. By this time we had finished our burgers. A 3rd round arrived, this time they were crispy, but again not piping hot but passable. Ray was attentive and did the best he could...it seems it was the kitchen that didn't do their part.  And unfortunately we did not enjoy our experience.  My Sam Adams was icy cold and water was plentiful. Ray's service was good which was the best part of the evening. Oh! The tabletop point of sale tool is cool...no more prisoner by check as long as you pay by credit card.

This is my first review and I've always had a decent dining experience when coming here, but I am completely grossed out right now. I came here today for a quick lunch. I ordered an appetizer, which was good, and a garden burger with mac n cheese as my side. My burger came out with fries instead of the mac n cheese. I had to put my order in again for my correct side. Waited for a few minutes, no problem. When I got my mac n cheese, I noticed that something black was sticking out on the side of the dish underneath the cheese. I thought somehow a topping of some sort was accidentally mixed in, but when I inspected it, I noticed that it wasn't a topping. It looked like a fairly large piece of glass or sharp object. I alerted my waitress and she calmly took it to the back. After 10-15 minutes, the manager came to my table and said that it looked like an acrylic nail. She proceeded to tell me that she asked all of her staff about it, but no one's nails matched the one that was found in my food. She then told me that none of the cooks or servers are allowed to wear fake nails or long natural nails. So....where did it come from? They make the mac n cheese individually so I would think that whoever prepared the dish would be the person to blame. The nail was actually baked into the noodles and cheese. The manager was nice and seemed to show concern so I did not make a scene, but this is serious. First, it's absolutely DISGUSTING. Do you know what kind of germs are under nails? Second, what if I swallowed it?! They took the burger off of my tab (still paid for my apetitzer and drink) and apologized, but if I choked and died, an apology would do no good. Hopefully management gets down to the bottom of this because it's unacceptable. I won't be eating here again anytime soon.

Although my quest for the perfect burger continues, I have to give credit where credit is due.  Red Robin is a staple for quality food and a good time. The environment and staff are always positive, welcoming, and the place is spotless. The collage of American photographs and memorabilia saturate the walls. This coupled with the HD televisions, full bar, and loud music make this place a reliable spot to grab a bite.  During today's visit, I grabbed Red Robin's blue cheese burger. A blue cheese burger is one of my favorite burgers and has been for a long time. But Red Robin's has to be the best blue cheese burger around. Not only did they add shoe string onions and an onion bun, but they threw on some mystery sauces that really caught me off guard. Coupled with their famous fries and table-top seasoning, it truly was a marvelous burger.  I specifically remember that towards the end of my meal, I thought to myself, "THAT is one tasty burger!"  Al l in all, I love Red Robin. I sometimes forget about it but that's going to change hear in the near future. PS- get the strawberry lemonade!  Can't wait to go back.
Khai was such a great guy  My mom and I came in super hangry and he was funny, personable, knowledgable of the menu, and very efficient. I really enjoyed our meal here and the atmosphere.

Don't understand why the bad reviews. I went there for the first time today and I'm vegan, which means I need to ask a hundred questions before ordering something. The staff was super friendly and helped me a lot to choose what to eat.  I had the Banzai with Boca vegan patty, no mayo, no cheese, add avocado and add onions and sweet potato fries on the side. One of the best burgers I've ever had. Super friendly staff, amazing food and good price. Definitely will come back.

I've gave this place a few shots. I was beyond elated to know that they had gluten free bread and fries! Makes me not have to drive all the way to Santa Monica for a gf burger. But unfortunately their service is bellow par. They aren't too nice and you see them when they take your order and to bring your bill. It might as well be a place of self service. They have bottomless fries but you get a small amount and by the time you order more you're done with your burger.  On a positive note their food is yummy and their fries are tasty.  I will come here knowing I'm going to be here for a while.

This Red Robin is alright. The service is quick and the food is decent. I really like the turkey croissant, personally.  The mac and cheese is really good too. In general though, Red Robin is slightly overpriced.

I believe the biggest problem with this location of Red Robin is their seating layout. It was not well thought out. All you have to do is go inside and you will quickly understand what I am saying. There are very few tables with any level of privacy or personal space, most on stacked right next to one another. I realize this is to maximize business. But, it is truly a poor business model as I know many people, including myself, who are very reluctant to go here due to this fact.   Then, there are the outdoor tables; where I prefer to sit. These tables are much more separated. The problem is, there is an exterior bench, right on the wall of this restaurant, where people sit and smoke. People also stand right next to the wall and smoke. This can really ruin your lunch or dinner.  The food is Red Robin. The servers are good or bad depending on who you get.  And, oh yeah, don't believe the commercial about a free burger on your birthday. The commercial doesn't tell you that you have to be signed up with their program to get one. I've had a few friends go here on their birthday expecting to get their eats on for free. But, no-go.

Hello, The reasoning for this review is too share my recent experience and the horrible customer service at your South bay Galleria location. On April 14th, 2015 myself and my co-work stopped by to grab lunch. After browsing the menu, we were ready to order. I ordered my norm, in which was the 'Royal Red Robin" with no bun and asked that my egg be cooked medium well. Before I could even get my request out regarding how I'd like my egg cooked, the waitress stated I could only choose from a" well-cooked or sunny side up egg". Then thought that was odd because I am a repeating customer and not ONCE has a waiter or waitress stated I could only choose between the two. I then expressed my concerns to her and asked could my egg be made medium well? Waiting for a response, her whole demeanor changed as if she was irritated I asked. She then stated "well, the cook can only cook the egg those two ways" and stood there. Then I guess she thought better of it and said let me go asked just to make sure. After she walks off, I go to the restroom and I see our waitress in the counter speaking with another worker of Red Robin, African American girl. Shortly after, the same girl I saw our waitress speaking to came over and pretty much told me what I could and couldn't order very rudely. Not once did she introduce herself, I'm not sure if she was a manger or not; however, I feel like a proper introduction of who you are would have been more appropriated rather than speaking to me anything less than a customer. I would include her name but she did NOT have on a badge. At this point I was feed up and if were hadn't been for my co-worker with me, I would have left!  And afterwards, I'm assuming our waitress did not want to serve us because another waitress starting serving us. Please help me understand, if I'm paying for MY food to be cooked a certain way, "why is it so hard to do so"??? All I wanted was for my egg to be cooked medium well like I ALWAYS get it!  I absolutely love Red Robin and I often visit the Lakewood location, I've never had a problem.. They treat their customers so nice. We were in the area and stopped by and this location was beyond me. I didn't like the feeling of feeling like we had to just deal with it. We are customers like everyone else! Maria is who we were switched over too and the RUDE waitress prior to her name was Laura I believe.

So endless fries are pretty awesome but the customer service is equivalent to waiting at the DMV at this location. You look around and there are a shit load of available seats but for some reason there's a 20minute wait?  I've been to this location a few times already and it's always the same story.  If it weren't for the frign endless supply of fries and mongo bongo ranch sauce I wouldn't be still going here.
The food was good. My dessert was huge and great also. Special thanks to our wonderful waitress Brooke!
Maria is the best server and bartender!!! Always ask for her when stoping by. Always makes you feel welcomed is fast and has a smile to bright up any ones day
We stopped here after a Disneyland visit and were impressed by the quality and speed of service.  This Red beat our local Red Robin in every aspect.

Apparently corporate decided to make a few changes. Their portions are much smaller.  They are already over priced and the only reason why we would overlook that is because the kids loved their bottomless Mac n Cheese. However, they no longer offer bottomless Mac n Cheese.  The portion is much smaller than before and the kids ended up hungry as they do not like fries. The kids could careless about their bottomless fries. It was all about the bottomless Mac. Well, that's too bad. At least my children were equally upset about it and completely understand why we are NEVER coming back. They can keep their overpriced little portions to themselves.  That is just too bad.

The steak fries were abysmal.  Brown splotches from low quality potatoes and half of the steak fries were remnants.  I had the whiskey BBQ burger, I was given the choice of medium or well done, I choose medium but was served well done.   THe onions were fried nicely the cheese slightly melted and the lettuce was crisp with a nice crunch. They have placed computers on every table and use up allot of valuable table space.   There was a button to call a server on the screen but we still needed to flag a server to get our drinks and fries refilled.   When asked for the check the server showed how to pay the bill on the computer.  The tip was suggested at 20% but when I did the math it was actually more like 25%

Every time I come to red robin I leave happy. Right when you walk through the door you can smell the amazing food. I've been here hundreds of times and tried almost everything on the menu and I can honestly say I've never had a bad experience here.       Today I came in with a group of 12 and 4 of them are under the age of 6 and I can't believe how patient our waiter is because we weren't the easiest group to deal with      I hope this red robin never leaves this location cause I've been coming here since I was little and I'll keep coming here

Came here yesterday around 1 to have a nice meal with my husband and son for Father's Day after doing some shopping. First off the hostess was very unfriendly! No smile, no welcome to Red Robin, nothing! Couldn't believe she was allowed to be the hostess. Our waitress was very friendly. Except my husband and I's fries were cold. We got new ones that were hot. My baby had some fruit which was nice. We will be back though because we do like the food.

Been coming to this location for over 10+ years now.  Not as much now, but every time I go back, I am reminded why I used to come here so often. With all the new burger places popping up, I've been trying out all, but I still find myself coming back to Red Robin time after time.  The burger combos are fairly standard now as many places have similar toppings for the burgers, but I can't stay away from the steakhouse fries!  The fries are unlimited and you can ask them to bring you some before your order is even taken.  I think I eat at least 3-4 baskets' worth every time I am there. Sprinkle some of that tasty seasoning and it is straight up addicting! BBQ Whiskey River Burger is probably still my favorite after trying out all the different ones.  I guess I am sucker for the crispy onion straws.  The perfectly buttered toasted bun here is underrated. On the most recent visit, found out they also have petite versions of all their burgers.  Good for the ladies or if you just want to load up on fries haha. This is probably my favorite chain.  I like it so much that I don't even think of it as a chain! Once in awhile I'll order a strawberry lemonade and ask for extra strawberries just to relive the good old days.
I only came here for the salt seasoning, fries and bottomless drinks. Everything was mediocre.

I see all the bad reviews for this place BUT I can't complain. (More like just didn't take the time out to complain) Anywho...Went for the two tavern double burgers and appetizer promotional deal for 15 bucks. Had to speak with management to substitute one burger for turkey as I don't eat Beef which was a small hassle when Islands substitutes easily and for free. So she charged me 2 bucks extra for the substitution, yet when the burger finally arrived to our table there was only ONE patty, not two! (Sad face)  Feeling spiritual and on a "date night".... I didn't complain. The burger is NOT big and luscious like it looks like in the commercial either. NO two handed monster burger, not even close. The bun is a wee bit bigger than a McChicken's bun. It's a generally small burger but just enough food to be pleasantly full along with eating the bottomless fries. Also our fries were prepared fresh and arrived piping hot as I requested. "Interesting" Turkey Patty though... It's a pretty Odd, SUPER poultry flavored turkey patty overly moist and dripping with broth that tasted completely unnatural and manufactured. Like a giant McFrankin' nugget....I could only imagine the blended up turkey parts slapped together and molded into a patty.  I bet I won't catch a cold for years I'm so chicken juiced up, LoL!!  But hey, I'm still alive two days later....you will survive too. ( maybe :)

I really hope RR corp reads the most recent reviews. The former manager had gone out of his way to make sure everyone had a great experience here. It was organized and professional. NOW... They seem like they don't know what to do with a Friday night crowd. There was a full beer spilled that wasn't cleaned up for a full 4 minutes. Some of it splashed on us. It stunk up the area.  No one apologized for it. Then my salad with a Boca Burger came and the burger wasn't cooked. The manager didn't seem to understand what was wrong with it and we saw her roll her eyes at our waitress over it. Finally, the wrap my partner got was lacking 1/2 the ingredients. By the time my salad returned, everyone was done eating and ready to go. We will not return.

I've experienced better service than I got today at red robin. Today the service was really slow and unnecessarily since it was not busy, which is even more irritating.  Sat down, got our drink order. One mixed drink and one coffee. The coffee came first. It was cold. Asked for another cup. Five minutes later, my drink came, and it was watered down and flat. Had to ask for another one of that.  Food came, no napkins or silverware. Had to GET UP and ask for that because most of the servers were congregating near the hostess area and having a good time with each other instead of making rounds and seeing if people needed anything. I couldn't get anyone's attention! No one checked on us, and the only time we were asked if we needed anything else was after we had already gotten everything ourselves practically. Just bad service all around. The servers were more into chatting wtih each other than paying attention to the customer. The food is good here. I've never had anything bad. The food is 4 stars. The service is 1 star.

My roommate recommended this burger place and it is awesome! I ordered onion ring, the medium-rare burger "southern charm" and DP for sure. The burger contains beef, bacon, red onion, lettuce and it was so good. I assumed the burger would be gravy but the introduction of crunchy bacon made the texture balanced. The only flaw might be the price.

Not too much to say good here. The server was nice, but seemed rushed and didn't check back much. The food was indifferently prepared; nasty French fries, burger poorly made and presented.   Asked for new French fires, but they didn't come before we were ready to go - and they are supposed to be bottomless. I guess after one serving of cold floppy fries nobody orders a 2nd round.   Nothing to write home about. Should have gone to Islands...
Horrible is the only word I have for it.  RR is usually great, but this location has major issues. Horrible food, horrible service, horrible management.

I haven't had red robin in months due to bad service however I had to give it another chance due to the great tasty burgers and fries. I had a gift card from management from my previous bad experience however the staff here were amazing, friendly and welcoming. The manager made sure we were being taken care of and our server Christina was very very amazing and informative and friendly. Definitely glad I gave it another opportunity.
Unsatisfactory Service! Carmen (server) was rude: When we had a question, she said " Do you want me to answer your question or serve the food?"

Had another great experience here recently with a big group of friends. Had the Monster Burger and it was amazing!! Super cheesey....fresh, spongey bun that melts in your mouth...and tons of sauces that sit on top of the delicious patty. You really can't go wrong. Also had the fries, the onion rings and strawberry lemonade. Win, win, win!!!!

You know, the last time I came here I vowed I would NEVER return but my husband so pleasantly surprised me with dinner here and I succumbed to the unknown experience I nervously prepared myself for but I was pleasantly surprised from the moment we entered...  Something was different, what? I did not know but people were working cleaning and arranging, smiling and acknowledging! We waited for a booth and the "NEW" Manager (I didn't get her name) was so attentive and made sure our table was clean, and even asked my son if he wanted crayons and a coloring book. What a difference from my last experience.  Now to the server - he was so attentive and pleasant. Answered all our questions and didn't miss a beat when we requested something. The food came out fast and hot! We appreciated the attention he gave to us making sure we were completely taken care of. He'd only been working there for a few weeks but he really handled his area like a pro! Kudos to him and the new team there!  Totally opposite from our last visit which was chaotic and slow. Change is definitely good!

Crap service from the front door and onward. The hostess was rude and didn't even ask my name for seating. Not sure what her name was but her hair was very colorful. I know it's the holidays and you're busy but can you at least try to like your job? Enough about the hostess, let's move on to service. Our server was attentive and accurate but regrettably did not inform us of how their new tablet ordering system worked so we're just sitting there like jackasses without a clue. Bottom line is, the food is good but the service could use some major tweaking and fine-tuning. Don't go claiming you run off of some sort of system when you really don't.

I must say for being a chain burger restaurant, Red Robin puts out some pretty good burgers. I'm going to start off by saying that I can't believe they don't have the open faced chili burger anymore. It was so flavorful and amazing! Okay now time to move on... Burnin' love burger: Cayenne seasoned patty, jalapeños, pepper jack, spicy salsa, tomatoes, lettuce, chipotle mayo, all served on a jalapeño bun. YESSSS! I love spicy and this burger is perfect! It gives enough heat to make you break a sweat and has flavors jumping all throughout your mouth! Very good burger!  Freckled lemonade: Who doesn't love strawberry lemonade? Sweet sugary strawberries mixed with Minute Maid lemonade. PERFECT on a hot summer day! If you're not hungry just come here for this!  I knocked off a point just because the wait for the food can sometimes be pretty long even when they aren't that busy. Last time I waited around 35 minutes before my burger came out so I was a grumpy, hungry customer by the time it came out!

Excellent, friendly staff! Efficient!  Been going there for years, and always have a positive experience. The wait is never long. The longest I've waited for a table is 15 min. and I've been going there for 10yrs. All the staff is nice and very friendly.
Great food and for the most part great service. One of our waiters would constantly forget things but to be honest it was slammed in there so I can understand.  The tropical Mai Tai was super yummy

I used to love coming to Red Robbin it was one of our favorite restaurants when visiting the mall or simply to grab a bite to eat if we were craving it. However their service has gone downhill so much and the quality of the food isn't the greatest. Today on a Wednesday evening my mom and I had to wait at least 10 min. To be seated while the restaurant was almost empty. A lot of the sections were "closed" so we had to wait to be seated, the hostess ended up giving us a table at the bar section which was never closed to begin with so I'm not sure why we even had to wait to take a seat. Also when you look around all you see are servers hanging out by the kitchen area laughing and talking . Our waiter was really nice and I don't blame him. I blame the manager and the system they have running there, not sure how often I will visit Red Robbin after today's service, surely not impressed at all.

Unlimited fries are no where near unlimited. I get one refill, 2 max. That's with an hour meal. When fried are labelled as "unlimited" I expect 3-4 refills. Also, so tired of the slow, apathetic service. It takes *forever* for the food to arrive. Again, no fries are offered while waiting for the meal, the fries come with the slow-ass food. They've also gotten my order wrong. When I pay extra for a gluten-free bun due to a food allergy, the bun damn well better be gluten-free. I'm so done with this place, it's not worth the headache to eat here anymore.

Their burgers always hit the spot, but this location's service is often a miss.  On this recent visit, our waitress was already apologizing up front because she knew that the kitchen was running way behind.  The table next to us complained and got 50% off their bill.  Thus our waitress got proactive and let us know that there's a delay, and brought us fries ahead of time.   The table next to us tried to use a gift card, but the store's system was down so they couldn't verify the balance on the card.  Those patrons reluctantly said okay, they won't use the card this time, but that just meant that Red Robin just swindled them into spending a lot more money than intended when those customers just wanted to cash in on their gift card value.

1st time here and I've got Ta say the that DGB Burger was Fire , no lie. It was Greasy but I like Greasy.... Lol .... The Presentation was Terrible but I can't complain because the Taste Gave me Life. My server was a Tad Bit Discombobulated , (dropped water, brought wrong food, forgot fries) but provided service with a Smile so A for effort. I'll be BAAACK,  good Eats Y'all ... Shar Said It .... YUMMM

Another of my family's favorites  Bottomless fries, strawberry lemonade (so yummy), great burgers, and a friendly staff. What more can you ask for? Also suggest signing up for the Red Royalty card if you haven't already. Great idea for families and those on a budget. Love it when I get a free burger

I took my family to eat here on Saturday afternoon.  We placed our order about 1:15 and didn't receive our food until 2:00.  I had asked our waiter why our food was taking so long and was told that they got slammed for lunch.  This answer took me buy surprise considering it was lunch time and  it should be expected to be busy.  I had stop going to this location because the food takes a long time to cook.  I live close by but I go to the Lakewood or Cerritos location.   Please have the kitchen speed up the orders so everyone can be happy.
the worst service ever the server  got attitude  cause we ask for  our food to be made over

service is shit.  why ask how everyone wants their burger if theyre all going to be well done anyway? why did iy take over 20 minutes for me and my dad to get our kinda warm burgers that were sloppy and skimpy? whats the point of bottomless fries if your waiter only comes to check on you once youre done with your burger?  thank you for my hardly warm refill on fries.  yes, im writing this review mid meal.  i think i want to ask for the manager.  this is dumb.

Red Robin was a mixed feeling. It wasn't a pleasant experience to say the least. It received a 3 star strictly because the food was good. The food was excellent in quality and taste. IT WAS NOT HOT! That was the biggest disappointment. It wasn't cold either though.  The service was slow and not really attentive. It took 15 minutes to get our drinks and order. After it took another 20 minutes to get food... So took a total of 35 minutes to order and get the food to our table. Then it wasn't even fresh and hot?? I ordered boneless chicken wings that came with potato chips. So red robin is telling me it takes 20 mins to fry chicken wings and apply sauce and let it become cool before giving it to the customer? I was really disappointed in the service. I seen the manager doing more work then the actual waiter. Our waiter checked up on us once. Adding to the bad service it was a Thursday night at 9 PM. Our waiter only has 2 other tables. A total of 7 people to serve.  I did forget to mention the table next to us who was also served by the same waiter came in 10 minutes after us and got their food the same time.  They never told us why our food took to long. Or apologized.  The food was a 3 star. The service was a 0. Go to red robin if you have time to kill.

When we got here they said there was a 20min wait. 30 min passed, and I went to ask and noticed our name was off the wait list. Finally got a table 40min later. Put our order... Never got my salad! Feeling a bit irritated by now!!!! After waiting 10 min I asked for my salad... Another 10min passed FINALLY got the Cesar salad DRY. I love the burgers here, but just not satisfied with the service today!!!

Red Robin is our go to place for birthday lunches with a group of work friends.  The service and burgers are consistently good.  My favorite burger that I always go for is the Blu Burger which is topped with a hearty amount of blu cheese, fried onions, lettuce, tomato and dressing.  My burger is always cooked perfectly as I order, slightly pink.  All the burgers come with streak fries.  The fries are sprinkled with seasoning salt and are perfectly crisp and tender.  Gotta love the bottom less fries! If you join the Red Robin club, you get a free burger during your Birthday month!
Patrice was excellent! She was on top of everything and made everything easy showing how how to use the tablet for games and adding appetizers.

Worst service I've had in my life. Wish I could give 0 stars. Watched every table around us get their food. Never even got out appetizer when the table next to us got their appetizers and meal who came well after us. Left the restaurant after that and our waiter didn't even notice.

3/25/16 Torrance Rosalinda was an excellent server!! She was very attentive. She approached our table to take drink orders within two minutes of being seated, brought out the drinks and took our order right away. She returned to our table to check if we needed anything while we waited for our food, mind you, the food took less than 15 minutes to arrive at the table. As we ate she brought drink refills three times and checked on us two other times as well.  5 stars for Rosalinda! The food was typical Red Robin. Ordered 1. Bacon cheeseburger- typical 2. Bowl of Clam chowder- mediocre; consistency was thin but flavor was good 3. Bone-in Buffalo wings with Yukon chips- the wings could have used a little bit more sauce; the Yukon chips were basically potato chips 3 stars for the food; it was average.

First time coming here and it was amazing I don't know why this place has 3 stars?! I'm here on a BUSY Saturday night and the service is still on point! Best experience ever I would definitely come back and recommend to my friends!!!
Worst Red Robin I've been to. Service sucked big time! Asked for a refill on fries and they never came - the original fries were cold. Never go there again!
I got my usual Banzai Burger(it has cheese, pineapples,lettuce,tomatoes&teriyaki sauce) with bottomless fries with a Strawberry Lemonade. Yummy as usual&good service from my server Brooke.
The buffalo bone in wings and the onion rings are so delicious. Best ones I have ever tried by far. I go to red robin every week  because that's how addicting they are.

Been here numerous times, but today's visit was just not a great experience. Quality of service was great, despite being busy. Our waitress repeatedly apologized for our long wait. Food was great. My issue is with the hostesses with the long hair seating customers. I understand space is tight in the bar area, but why not require them to have their hair put up in a bun? These girls had ridiculously long hair & braids, yet whipped me and the tabletop with their constantly as they walked by... A restaurant staffer's hair shouldn't be touching the table top and shouldn't be whipped around.

Went to this location today with my family since they live in Carson. I'm originally from Redondo but I now live in the SFV and we have the Glendale location which I've never had an issue with. The food is great as always. The service at this location sucks though. The waitress started off attentive but got progressively worse the 1 1/2hrs we were there.  She would come by and check in with the surrounding tables and not even turn our way. I had to yell out "excuse me!" a handful of times just to have her refill our drinks. Also, RR now has these little tablets at every table that you can order food on, play games, pay your bill or call your server. Apparently these things do nothing as I pushed the button to CALL SERVER and all it does is blink. I have no idea if it's relaying to the front or if it's just supposed to get the waiters attention with the tiny blinking red light on it. Either way, it's pointless as it didn't have our waitress come over any quicker.  $86 bill she got a $6 tip and should consider herself lucky she got that. I don't really come to this location so probably won't be back for a good long while. Don't come here if you're on a time crunch, you'll be a while.  2 stars for the food.

Ever since I moved to LA I became a regular to this Resturant. I love Red Robin and its been 15 years now that my first choice in a Resturant would be Red Robin. I drive 15 miles every time just to enjoy their wonderful burger and fries and of course their unique ranch.  Tonight I had the pleasure that the manager himself took our order and suggested some amazing drinks which is a good start for the weekend.  Thank you for your amazing food and thank you for amazing service

Birthday month 2013! Free red robin burger (ANY KIND!) during the month of your birthday for joining their Red Robin Loyalty club!  Red Robin isn't the joint I usually go to for my burger fix and I bet it has been tough to compete with the rise of gourmet burgers in the restaurant scene. Their free birthday burger promo definitely lured me in to give Red Robin a try. RR isn't horribly expensive (avg $10 a burger with side) but their burgers are pretty regular and definitely smaller than expected (I could finish an entire burger on my own). The best part is their bottomless side!! You can get either fries, BROCCOLI or a side salad. They do give a small portion of the side (probably so one doesn't waste) but you can keep ordering them.  Service was pretty average...probably because we sat at the bar area. We felt bad asking for more refill of our bottomless side. Looks like this place is one of those I'll frequent once a year ;)  Parking: Easy (located in the South Bay Galleria)  Additional loyalty club perk: free 10th item (they also offer entrees, salads, etc...) A note about the loyalty club: You can sign up online but they will verify your identity with A PHONE CALL (which I find the most annoying part).

This used to be one of my favorite burger joints, but lately quailty and costumer service have really suffered.  Last few time's I've been in the food just takes too long to get out.  Our serving staff seem to be fine, but stuff just takes forever, comes out cold.  Bottomless fires sounds great, but they don't really bring them out anymore so if you want to keep eating fries you are going to have to wait and wait and wait.  Guess I'll be going across the street to Islands for burgers from now on....

The food was okay a little cold.  Waitress was really busy not attentive.  The chicken pruchetta was not good no flavor in my humble opinion. Best thing about this visit was the second round of fries. Ohh so they did take the sandwich off my check but didn't ask if we wanted dessert and I did.... Off to Starbucks

I really LOVE the burgers here! This particular location is always crowded due to it being at the mall. Came on a Thursday night. It still was busy but only waiting 5 minutes for seating. Perfect! Our waitress Natalie was great! She took our order fast  & came back with our food in 15 minutes. Great service!

This place is one that I have been going to for about 10 years. It is situated at one of the galleria mall entrances. I have never waited more than 5 minutes to be seated, but than again I usually go as a party of two. It does seem to remain busy and gather a young crowd because of its location.  The service is great. The whole crew works as a team and is very responsive to your needs. Everything is clean.  The food is reasonably priced and tastes really good. They have tons of burgers and most entrees come with bottomless steak fries. They also have salads, wraps, chicken, fish, desserts, malts and a full service bar.This is a great place for a date or even to bring the whole family for a nice lunch or dinner. It gets loud because of the people who frequent there so if you are looking for a romantic date night after the movies... This might not be the place.  If you want decent food, a nice easy meal time and don't mind noise and people, then I recommend you give it a try.

Red Robin food sort of is what it is.  This review is for the service we received. Yesterday was my first visit to this Red Robin.  We were seated at a table in the bar area, which was a mistake.  After sitting for a solid 5-10 minutes without anyone acknowledging us or offering to pour a drink, the waitress finally arrives.  I ordered a diet coke - which was completely and utterly flat (some people like this, I do not). I was able to get through two sodas without the food arriving.  At that point, we had already been sitting in the restaurant for more than 30 minutes.  I was starving.  Looking around, I realized that the handful of people seated before us also remained food-less.. this didn't bode well. When the food finally came, my burger was acceptable and what I expected from a Red Robin.  Getting the check was another 20 minute ordeal (even when my companion just shoved his card into the waitress' hand without taking the check to examine it). I don't know what this place's service is usually like, but I would describe my experience as "glacially paced".  Unacceptable.  Perhaps it is different outside the bar?  *IF* I return here for some reason, I will ask not to be seated in that area.
Excellent service very quick with 6 children & 5 adults.. Drinks & appetizers came out together quickly and the food came about the time we finished the appetizers.. Food was excellent...

After cruising around Living Spaces we strolled over to the Galleria mall to walk around and have dinner.  We decided on Red Robin as I am trying to eat better :o) We got there around 7:00pm and we were seated right away.  I ordered the Ensenada Chicken Platter and my friend ordered the Turkey Burger...and he also got a cup of tortilla soup and their new Peachberry Drink...which was fantastic.   All in all the food was good...not great but good.  The bill was around $40.00 including tip...it was an average value for the meal...nothing too special.  But they have a big menu and variety to choose from.  The service was good too.  So when in doubt you can always come here for good food at an average price!

Went in to Red Robin today  because usually it is my favorite place to eat. It was quite busy. However, I was seated in the bar area 10minutes later the waitress asked me what I would like to drink. Told her Diet with lemon. 20minutes later, no drink and no service. If you want to go to a restaurant on the weekend I would recommend going someplace else or to the Red Robin in a nicer area where the quality of service and management is better. This is by far the worst place I have been to.

I go here fairly often because it offers a great vegan party for its signature burgers. I've tried a few of them, all great with the vegan patty. Based on food quality itself, this place does deserve more than three stars. My reason for an average rating is its terrible service. I want to say that out of all the times I've been here, I've only had one time where I said, "Hey, this was awesome service." Actually, the first time I ever went to this location was for my birthday. I took a rather large party, so I knew service would be a bit slower than usual; what I didn't expect was taking 20 minutes to take our order, half an hour for food, and upon receiving my food, still seeing cheese on the patty after I asked for none and let her know I was vegan. 20 more minutes later I get my burger, but not my sweet potato fries. 15 minutes later, I got my fries.  Worst experience ever. Manager hooked it up with a free burger for the next time, but that didn't do much to change my perception of the staff.

I forgot the email I received where they said I could get half price burger for my half birthday...so I was pleasantly surprised when I went to pay for the burger and it was only 5 bucks!  Join the burger club.

Really thought this experience was going to be different. The hostess was so pleasant and surprisingly for a Saturday night, the wait was really short. That's where the positive experience ends. Our server's name was Carmen and she was horrible. She couldn't bring us refills on our drinks if get life depended on it. She forgot to put in for our refills on fries twice! If the rest of the staff was as incompetent as her, I would never go back.
The workers are very nice and the food is delicious. It was my first time coming here and they made my experience a great one. Thanks!

2 golden words: Bottomless Fries. I love them. Especially when I shake a bit extra of Red Robin seasoning. Sure ill probably increase my blood pressure and water retention, but so what! They're so good. Burgers are good. They're a nicely sized. I generally live anything with cheese and bacon. My favorites include the: *Bacon Cheeseburger- classic burger with bacon and cheese *Guacamole Bacon Burger- a step up from the classic with guacamole.  *Royal Red Robin Burger-nice! Bacon, cheese, and wait for it...topped    with a fried egg. Transformed into something a lil special. It's cool that you can substitute turkey for beef. You can also get a wheat bun instead, or no bun at all. Service is okay. If there's a wait, it's usually not too long.

This place is the best Robin I've been to.  Staff is friendly and food is always great.  Even when mistakes have been made, they own up to them and fix them.  I particularly love the wait staff at the bar.  I also love they have a rewards program and you can get a free burger meal after your eighth burger.  This place is by CPK.

slow service.  I had always wanted to try this place/chain.  I finally did! It wasn't what I had expected.  I expected something flavorful, different and delicious. What I got was a meh. I could have gotten the same burger/onion experience at a good hamburger joint.  Nothing special, just overpriced food.

We recently ate at Red Robin. A very nice surprise. It was delicious. The Blue Cheese Burger was the best we've ever had. Juicy, seasoned perfectly and cooked to perfection. Sweet potatoes french fries were crispy and warm.  We shared the BBQ chicken salad that was fresh and plentiful..service was excellent and the food came from the kitchen fairly soon. A nice experience all around. One burger and bottomless french fry along with one salad and no drinks: $24.00. A little pricey. Couldn't afford to come here too often. But a nice place for a treat. Will go back for sure.

This place is pretty average for service and food, the real reason why I come here is becaues I love there refillable fries. But remember this, every waiter is a gate keeper to more fries and its an up hill battle to get more of them with extra ranch. You will never win, you will always get less fries then you expect and the servers will never give them all up. Truth be told Red Robin hires leprechauns and they like to hoard all there golden fries and parade around them at the end of the night. They will only give out a few at a time all night, so if your patience is great you'll have fun eating your 6 or 7 fries they give you when they refill your basket.

I don't get to make it to Red Robins often but in the past my experience has been good...until I ordered the BOCA Vegan Burger.  I was soooo hungry so when my rubbery pattie on wheat bread came, I chomped down as much as I could but the burger had no taste at all.  Only the spicy mustard was dressing up the flavor. So the evening time comes, and that BOCA burger is still on my stomach.  I drank some rasberry tea and it didn't help.  Then I drank some of my Senekot tea and that was the beginning of the end...I threw up from 9:30 p.m. Sunday to 5:30 a.m. Monday.  Keep in mind, the throw up of the food was is in the first two rounds, the rest was that nothing throw up and very painful each time. I don't know what was in that burger, but for sure, I thought I was going to meet my maker.  If it wasn't for my husband buying me some Nausea medication, I don't know how long I would have been throwing up.  Needless to say, not everything that appears healthy is good for you.  So long Red Robbins, it was good while it lasted, but I am shell shocked as a result.   P.S.  Lost 3 pounds as a result in less than 24 hours.

The worst sever ever!  She is LUCKY to have gotten a tip. Thanks to Isiah from Mexico, he  saved her fat ass! Luckily, I was with a few Ppl  from abroad and did not want to go gangsta on this idiotic server. The burgers are not even comparable to Oh Burger,  I hop, Wendy's , Carl Jr.  or Fat Burger! Best deal is to buy the 6.99 burger cause the 8.99 is only a hair strand bigger.  The worst onion rings in the world,  greasy, and small. The sweet potatoes fries  were like Burger king SP fries,  which really sucks! The atmosphere was friendly at the entrance and thecashier  Chris and Mgr. Isiah, Robin was cool, but the assigned served sucked with a  capital S.  If ur gonna serve mediocre burgers for 9,00  at least get decent servers .

LOVE THE FOOD SERVICE IS THE SHIZZ I always forget to bring one of my moms big purses to smuggle the BOTTOMLESS fries out, but oh well. Burgers are good, the Strawberry Lemonade..HAS REAL LIVE STRAWBERRIES IN IT aaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhh it can also induce a minor drug habit, since it's equivalent to cocaine, that's how damn good it is, so be careful.

I hate to be mean, because I came here with a very good friend, but Red Robin is no good. I'm not even talking about the place itself, but the very concept is flawed.  Why do we need a place that uses phrases like "HUGE" "GIANT" and "BOTTOMLESS" to describe their food? Why are the salads and the wraps just as calorie heavy as the burgers? Get a hold of yourself, society!  The waitress was very nice and the place is very "family friendly" which I guess means that your kids will be in a safe very colorful atmosphere by slowly being killed with artery-blocking fat.

Had a nice experience. Enjoyed the bacon burger (husband) and the BBQ burger (me). On my burger I loved the BBQ sauce and probably could have gone without the fried onion rings on the burger (but they were tasty on the side). Also we ordered our fries crispy (yum!) and asked for them before our burgers came out which was a nice treat. The manager was very nice and interactive with all of the customers. Enjoyed. Will come back (and this place always seems busy)

I had the Red Tavern Double Burger with fries. Burger was amazingly good, but 3 days later, I can still taste it no matter how much I brush my teeth!  Fries were ok, but I could do without the seasoned salt they put on them. In fact, they had a huge bottle of seasoned salt on the table so i don't know why they put them on the fries for you...Food was served prompt and hot when it arrived to my table. Server was nice, but he reached over this ledge they had instead of walking around and putting the food on the table. I'd go here again.

Service is always excellent and is the true today.  However food preparation was problematic contained sauce that was specifically asked to be removed. The replacement dish was quickly delivered but contained bones.   Manager was consulted and made statement that there could not be in any bones because he chicken is prepackaged. Really INSULTING comment. We're not crazy.  In the end the problematic meal was taken off our bill.  His was good but we could have done without the comment in the first place.

came for a couple drinks since we were still early for our movie. nice bartender dude and they had a Clos du Bois cabernet available. we got that fudgy cake thing too for our choco/sugar fix. we probably won't be back for food. but, overall, its and okay spot.

Great service, great food. The meat in my burger was great  quality not one complain about it.. Love that there not blasting music like other restaurant's and the amount of attention for there clients is in point. Our server Lizz was great.
One of our favorite family restaurant. Good burgers and bottomless fries. Banzai Burger with garlic fries with a freckled lemonade. Sand in your shorts if you are looking for something with alcohol.

We went there on tues after noon, ordered  the tavern burger and asked for bbq sauce . We're just waiting n waiting she goes to wait on other tables my burger is cold by this time. I spoke to manager the only thing he could say is I will get u bbq sauce i was upset. Before this happened i over heard the same waitress telling the manager that she didnt want to explain to me about a coupon i wanted to use.  But the burger was good . This place has no good service here this has happened before waiting for service..this is what you pay your money for.. you would think at southbay galleria they would hire more experienced workers.. Smh

slow, unfriendly and dirty restaurant----  however after I e-mailed a complaint to red robin they promptly forwarded the e-mail and the manager contacted me and apologized and invited us to come back and try it again, and we will. fingers crossed the standards are raised to be like most of the other red robins we have tried. update:  we went back and tried this restaurant again after speaking to the manager and it was a MUCH more pleasant experience!  If nothing else, A.J. is a superb manager!  full review here:
Doug sucked he charged me 6 dollars for 2 extra pieces of fish which should have only been 3 dollars he didn't give us any utensils and never refild our drinks bad service
Food is okay but the service sucks they need to hire more ppl  or just dnt come when its crowded its better when it's not

Stopped by for dinner.........food was just ok, I asked for well done on the burger (I don't care if its dry) but yet when I cut in half it was still bleeding.......only 4 onion rings.......oh well. Doubt we will return. Service was not that great either, was being rushed......didnt even get to order dessert.......... I guess they thought I didn't know how to tip...... if the service would've been better It would have been $10 tip on a $25 check instead of the $6 they got.
It's red robin, nothing fancy and nothing to complain about. The burgers are good and you can't go wrong when bottomless fries are involved.

This used to be one of my favorite places to eat. Red Royalty member. But today, the service hasn't been that great. I came with my daughter who is CLEARLY over the age of 10. I told the greeter table for 2 and he said it would be just a few moments. No problem. There was a party of 4 ahead of me, so I didn't mind. After the party of 4 was seated, another party of 2 came and was seated immediately! I got up and asked the greeter if he forgot about us. He apologized, said he was new then proceeded to seat us. When we got to our table, my daughter noticed that she had a child's menu! We called the waitress over and she gave her the regular menu and took her drink order.  After we decided what we wanted, we placed our orders and I placed my drink order. I waited and waited for my drink. Our food came, but still no drink. The waitress came back to check on us and I informed her that I was still missing my drink.  Although my food was delish, I must admit that the service wasn't that great today. Perhaps Stacked in Del Amo has me spoiled.

I actually am a big fan of Red Robin.  Why the 3 stars??  Went with my mom, and our first set of silverware, was EXTREMELY DIRTY. D: It had white crispy stuff stuck to it, on both the fork and knife, and same with my mom's!  So, we ask for another set of silverware....why was this one also dirty? :/ Later, I ask for a to-go box....and when I got it, there was some strawberry lemonade inside.. -__________- C'MON MANNN!  It was just really unsanitary..but, the food was good. Kind of worried if there was anything inside o.O

Food is quite filling and tasty. Ordered guacamole bacon burger with bottomless coleslaw, and a bottomless root beer float.  Food was awesome but server was not quite present.  Then again,  it was a holiday.

Lots of seating and conveniently located within the Galleria Mall. RR has better fries than most other places and even though they don't have a huge selection of beers they do have one of my favorite beers.

We went to Red Robin because we had a gift card and my friend remembered it being a good place to eat. Well he ordered what was supposed to be a gourmet hamburger-it was almost $15.It looked wonderful in the photo on the menu. It was so not gourmet! It was downright bad. It was skinny, not tasty, and totally disappointing. I ordered a sandwich - that was pretty good, but it came with soup. The soup - maybe 3 oz, came in a teeny tiny bowl  (if you could even call it that). It was supposed to be French onion soup. It looked absolutely disgusting. I sent it back and got tortilla soup. To make up for the gross onion soup, they brought out a full size bowl of tortilla soup. Even that didn't taste good- seems it must have been thickened with flour or corn starch. Last time we're going to Red Robin.
Not good service, Not the best food. Greasy fried food. Overdone burger, undercooked bacon. Maybe we went on an off night. But we're not going back to find out.

I really like this place because of their BOTTOMLESS GARLIC FRIES (you'll have to ask for them, $1.50 more, but worth it!) and their new ideas for burgers every now and then. I'm really writing this review because the manager here, Nicole, was nice enough to comp us one of burgers when my Red Rewards card wasn't working. Favorites: A.1. Peppercorn Burger 5/5 Royal Red Robin Burger 4/5 BOTTOMLESS Garlic Fries 4/5 Poppyseed Honey Mustard Sauce 4/5

I regret choosing Red Robin over Island Burgers to eat dinner at.  It should have been a tall tail sign that we made the wrong choice when the restaurant is pretty empty at 7:45 PM.   Upon entering, we saw several tables that were littered with the previous diner's cups, utensils, and baskets (food is served in a basket).  After we were seated a waitress was prompt in taking our food and beverage order, but extremely slow in bring out our drinks.  In fact, our drinks came out at the same time our food did.   To further emphasize our wrong decision on where to eat at, the person that served our food said, "it's really slow here tonight."  Well, if it's that slow, then why didn't you take the initiative to clean the dirty tables rather than stand around the bar area and watch television?   Eventually our waitress came back around and asked if we wanted refills on our beverages and more fries.  I wonder what gave her the impression we would like a refill, us sipping on a straw to obtain the last bit of melted ice from the bottom of our cups?  Plus, how are you supposed to enjoy a burger without fries?  On the plus side, the burger was cooked well and had a lot of flavor. After what seemed to be an eternity of starring at dirty tables and staff standing around the bar area, which was actually 15 minutes, we still haven't received our refills.  At that point, we wanted neither and just wanted to get out of there.  I was impossible to get the attention of anybody, so we had to go to the front counter to ask for our check. I guess it was evident we weren't satisfied with our service, so the hostess retrieved the manager to ask about our experience.  We explained to her our complaints and issues regarding the service and she apologized.  It wasn't until she actually looked around the restaurant for herself and realized we weren't exaggerating how dirty the restaurant looked.   If you're contemplating on where to eat while you're at the South Bay Galleria, consider Island Burgers or California Pizza Kitchen.  You don't want to leave a restaurant with regret and remorse, but a satisfied pallet and tantalized taste buds.

Just a nice place to have burgers. You can bring big parties here or just a small table for two. The burgers here are pretty good and you get "bottomless" fries with all of them. The menu also has seafood, chicken, sandwiches, salads, and soups. A favorite of mine is the Souper Sandwich combo. I get a cup of clam chowder and a BLTA crossaint. Plus they serve alcohol. This particular location is attached to the South Bay Galleria but you can access it from the parking lot. There's plenty of parking and it's right next to CPK and Starbucks.

We gave this place one more chance since the past times we have been here were not that great, but yesterday everything was perfect. Great costumer service, food was delicious, not a long time to wait to be seated, everything was excelent. Had a great time, definitely coming back soon!

The food is good, service is okay, our waiter was very friendly and very pleasant. The downfall is it took 25 minutes to get a kids meal and a salad, the waiter had too many tables. Visually the restaurant looks dirty due to the age of it being built in the early 80s with no real upgrades since it's been open, however all in all it's a pleasant experience and you can't beat the free endless French Fry refills.

I've been a customer here for quite some time now and usually I get great customer service. But today was a different story. I was sitting in the bar area for about 10-15 minutes without being acknowledged! Not even a " sorry but we'll be right with you." ! Nothing! I felt invisible. I was so disappointed. I don't think I'll be coming back for awhile. Note to manager, teach your staff to work on their customer service skills!!!  It's really horrible that I'm even writing this review because I loved going there! I went to CPK and was served right away!!! Thank you CPK for valuing my time and business!!!

Ok. I was Hungry one night and saw the commercial for the Bottomless steak fries that looked SO SEASONED Crisp and HOT! Stopped by a few days later, of course ordered the steak fries, the Croissant blt sandwich which was pretty good, Although I requested my croissant to be heated, it did NOT come out heated but it still tasted buttery/soft/good. my BF ordered their burger, it was Good, the steak fries came out and looked NOTHING like the commercial..sURPrising? NO. Looks NOTHING like how it did on the commercial!!!!!  The fries came out room temp. WITH NO seasoning and there were literally 8 pieces of it.  we req'd more, which came out fresh.  1st batch came out room temp,while the 2nd batch came out hot. they do have the seasoning on the table so you can add however much you please.  the Limeade drink DID NOT come in those fancy glasses, NOT that It really mattered but she didn't make it that good.  and OF COURSE I asked her for another in a to-go cup.. which TASTED MUCH BETTER. WTH. Guess 2nds are best. HERE.  Service was good. No crowds on a weekday afternoon.

Bottomless Root Beer Float -- those are 4 glorious words!  That's right peeps!  An all you can eat/drink root beer floats!  And, hold on...it's only $3.19.  Are you kidding me?  The other thing I love is that it is technically considered a "beverage", and not a "dessert".  OMG - OMG - OMG!   MENU SELECTIONS --- Of course, they feature burgers and great steak fries (all you can eat with each order), but Red Robin's really do have a nice variety of a little everything: salads, pastas, soups, and more.  Selected by yours truly on this visit, a Patty Melt ( ). FRENCH FRIES TIP OF THE DAY --- Eat half of your burger to consume even more fries, and take the other half to go.    HAPPY HOUR (M-F; 3pm-6pm; 8pm-close) --- Drinks, plenty to choose from, ranging from $2.50 to $4.50 ( ), and appetizers ranging from $3-$7 ( ). SAPPY ADVERTISING --- surrounded everywhere, some funny, some not, and some just lame.  C'mon, new shrimp tacos look/sound good - but you don't LURE shrimp!  ( ), you lay down a net and pull it up silly!  Here's a link on how to catch shrimp:  .  If English is your second language, a 'shrimp lure' is used to catch certain fish. ======================= = UNIQUE LOCATION INFO = ======================= SERVICE --- Theresa, my server on this day (3/29/2012), was nice, but management had her way overloaded.  So much so, she felt she has to apologize to each new table, "sorry, i am the only one over here."  She was also the hostess that greeted me, and walked me over to my table...that's way too much ground to cover for this larger than usual location. COOL FEATURES --- Nice outdoor patio area with 15 tables, and heat lamps. LESS THAN COOL PARKING --- A little difficult to park anywhere close to the front door -- you should be prepared to walk a bit or have luck on your side.  If you prefer to valet park, no problem, that's the feature here of this mall, which gets strong consideration at peak times. CONCLUSION --- It was just 'alright'.  With all the other choices out there, I don't think I will be running back here anytime soon.  Well, I lied...I will visit for the Root Beer Float.  Can this kind of float be a valid entry into the Rose Bowl Parade?  Can I be entered if I eat/drink too many of them?

My very first time ever stepping in to this place.  I don't come to this mall very often, but I am aware it has been her.  My wife and I took our kids and met her sister and her kids for a late dinner.  Checked in about 745ish and was told it would be about 30 min for a table(there was an entire section on the inside part of the mall that had 4 or 5 empty tables).  About 825 we were seated(I was changing a diaper) and everyone was asked what they wanted to drink.  From what I was told, water was not offered(I know in some places you need to ask for water now, so I am not holding it against anyone).  I made it back and was told everyone ordered drinks, I added coffee to it.  About 10 minutes later my wife and her sister got there drinks and I got my coffee, and none of the kids drinks were delivered.  From there we ordered our food.  I actually gave our waitress the ultimate decision of placing my order(gave her 3 options and let her pick) Just before the food arrived about 20 min later, two of the kids drinks arrived(milk and chocolate milk), After the food was put down we asked about another drink that was missing along with utensils and napkins(we had none).  I also asked about a side that was ordered with my sons meal and she went to get it. When she came back she did not bring the utensils(burgers are easy but mac n cheese is a little tricky) and did not mention the missing drink.  She came back about 5 min later with forks and one napkin for each person, and we were told there were no clean knives(at this moment, I am thinking to my self, "what the serious Fuck?"  How do you have a restaurant and not enough silverware for your guests?) and still no drink.  I took a bite of my burger, but then took the baby to let my wife eat.  Finished my cup of coffee.  I was asked in a pass by attempt if I wanted more coffee, which i definitely needed....  several minutes go by and I got up to walk around with the little fluffball.  I noticed that she wound up bringing a cup over.  When I made it back to the table, no creamer(wa wa waaaaaaaaa)  I was walking around still and asked our waitress if she could bring some creamer over...after a few more minutes of walking, I got to eat, the meal was the teriyaki chicken sandwich and it was very tasty, the SMALL cup of fries were tasty.  She walked by our table a few more times.  I was done with my food, my black coffee was still sitting there and about 10 minutes later she brought the creamer, and the check...(In my time walking around I saw a few people that were seated after us, and they got knives....)   I paid and I left...I honestly did not leave a big tip, $75 bill, and I left $10(I felt that was generous for poor service in my opinion) From what I heard, the food was good all around, but that bottomless fry idea did not exists at our table, not one was asked if they wanted more.  Once again, first time here, maybe I am supposed to ask, but if I didn't have to ask for more coffee, I figured I wouldn't have to ask for more fries... From there, we went outside to hang out for a bit and let the kids play and after about 20 minutes I looked in at where we were sitting, still a mess.... Overall, yes the food was tasty, but waiting, service, and vibe play a big part for me.  I am always willing to give a second try to a place, but a little effort will go a long way....(I am sitting here at 1145 pm drinking my second cup of coffee now....)

I've been coming to the South Bay Galleria since I was a pre-teen (oh gosh that was so long ago..waaa) and would always see Red Robin, but never went in. My co-worker Denise asked me to lunch and was surprised when I told her that I had never been before. Located next door to Nordstroms, we were greeted by two friendly employees. We got there pretty early so it wasn't crowded and we had choice of where we sat. Red Robin is known for the different types of burgers they offer. Having gone to various burger places (The Counter, Fat Burger and Ruby's to name a few), I would've expected their selection of burgers would have been a bit bigger. If you look at the menu there are a lot of burgers listed, however many of them have similar ingredients so there wasn't that much of a distinction among some of them. Not a deal breaker, but an observation to note.  I ordered a raspberry limeade drink mixed with sprite. It was really good, I may have to make a home version of it because it was really tasty. The other good thing about this drink is that it fell into the "refillable" category which was a plus. Most restaurants that have specialty drinks will let you have refills without having to pay. The only drinks deemed refillable are the sodas, teas and lemonades so this was a pleasant surprise.  For food I got a patty melt. I must say it is really hard to find good patty melts these days. It just didn't have that "patty melt" taste for me. The bottomless fries were pretty good, however ours seemed like they'd been sitting under a heat lamp rather than being freshly cooked. And since we were one of the first in the restaurant, you wouldn't think that we'd have warm fries, but rather hot out the fryer.  Red Robin has a full bar area and also have televisions throughout the bar area so I would think it would be a nice place to catch a game or come in for happy hour.  The ambiance was pretty nice and our server was really attentive, however it wasn't a memorable enough place for me to want to return. I'll stick to Ruby's!

If you sign up for there rewards program on your birthday your meal is free plus you get free ice cream!  And other perks with red robin rewards

Omg I had the worst service ever this Liz waitress the worst.
