lots of fun drinks and atmosphere.   then when ur stuffed walk around the mall.
The food is great....The onion rings are delicious and the sauce that comes with it will send you to heaven! !!
Service was great, order something horrifying but they more than gladly helped me get something spectacular. I appreciate the little things they do and that's what has me coming back.

The service was ATROCIOUS!!!! We had an hour to eat and leave due to the fact we had to get to the circus which was about 10 min away. We had to ask the server for EVERYTHING!!! There was always something missing and it took him 10-15 to get to our table.   What do you expect about the food....the same as every other sit down hamburger spot.  I usually rate them based on their service and this server had to be a trainee because he forgot EVERYTHING!!!

The food was good, however our waiter seemed overwhelmed by all the customer's ( I went on a Saturday night) . My group of 4  had to ask him for extra fries and drink refills multiple times before he attended us.

They used to be really good with service and their food, but this visit was a little different. Me and my grandmother have been coming here for the past 15 years and we have never ever been disappointed with this place, until today. When we were first seated a woman by the name of Theresa was our waitress. She was super friendly and I appreciated her positive attitude. Unfortunately I didn't appreciate the service. I'm not saying it's all her because she's a sweet woman and helped me out when I asked her to fix the bill for having lemon or some kind of foreign substance on my cup. I think I'm just more mad at the person who trained her. How could they not teach her to look at a glass before giving it to someone? And I'm also mad at whoever trained her because they didn't train her to wait at least 5 mins after getting my food to ask me how things are doing.  I don't know if I hadn't had a chance to take a bite yet. And thirdly, I felt that after she asked how the food was she felt that the customer service was over because I never seen her until it was time for the check. I had another waitress get me a refill on fries and to fix my drink. Normally this place is pretty good even when it's busy but the service today definitely sucked! The food was the same I was just a disappointed about the fries. They say bottomless, which they are but if they were why is it a pain to get a decent amount the first time around? I kind of felt jipped.

I am so appalled at the quality of service. First the hostess tells us to do self seating..we are curious as to why when there were plenty of booths available on the other side. We ask, she says "I just don't know if anything is available" we then say we will wait.. Within two minutes we are seated. The hostess was clearly lazy and service went down hill from our waiter to the food. Horrible customer service. I have been going to different Red Robin's for years..this was really the worst service and I wish I never stepped foot in there.

Red Robin reminds me a lot of Fuddruckers, but with one distinct advantage: It actually exists. Until recently, I had been searching tirelessly for the Fuddruckers location that supposedly exists in Torrance (allegedly near Lucille's BBQ) to no avail. Hungry and annoyed, I decided to give up and check out Red Robin and the mall attached to it. Part of the Hawthorne Galleria mall, Red Robin is an innocuous diner that juts into the parking lot, along with Starbucks and CPK. Its decor is nothing special: booths; soft, cushioned seats; metal trim. Honestly, I never got a good look because I've always ordered for take out. Ordering for take out sets Red Robin apart from its competitors. As you enter and tell the hostess your intentions, you take a seat, and then the waitress sits right down next to you to take your order. The first time this happened, I was taken aback, as I did not expect this level of service from a burger joint. Red Robin sets the bar in this regard. As for the food, I usually order the bacon cheeseburger, with no tomato, cooked medium-rare. Thick cuts of bacon accompany a large beef patty, lettuce, and sauce, and the bun is toasted--possibly cooked in bacon grease or oil. It is not the best burger I have ever had, but it's really darn good. And it comes with thick, crispy steak fries. I am not a fan of thick steak fries, but these are pretty good. But here is the secret: don't order a drink. After I place an order, I hop on over to Nordstrom's Espresso Bar in the mall and treat myself to an Italian cream soda. It's so good, but it obviously doesn't contribute to Red Robin's rating. Okay, maybe a little bit.

This is going to be a rant so I will tell you up front...  Food is ok. The service is TERRIBLE!       I walked in at around 7:45pm on a Monday night, there was no host and only about 6 tables in the whole place. I tried to get the attention of the many servers and what looked like a manager who walked by but they seemed to be too busy to simply acknowledge me. So I waited at the host stand and looked at a menu for 5 minutes before (who I believe to be the manager) came over to me. Before even asking how many were in my party or my name he told me to wait and he would get me when the next table became available. .. Ok. I realized they were probably all just flustered or something because there was another man waiting, visibly aggravated (apparently they had messed up his whole Togo order and he had been waiting for almost 30minutes)  My boyfriend showed up to meet me. We were greeted by a host finally who asked my name and preference for a table Or booth .. Booth .. She was polite told me it'd be 5 minutes. Then walked away. Again the manager came up to us, said to follow him, I could see he was walking us to a table and I was trying to explain to him Id like to wait for booth, he was very hard to communicate with, he cut me off and said "oh ok. You want booth?" Then just walked away leaving us in the middle of the restaurant.  Confused we walked back to the waiting area and sat down. Few minutes later a server came up to us and again asked how many and the name and walked us to a booth.  Finally we are seated, server said she'd be right with us and offered us water in the meantime. We both said yes she said she'd send someone over with them.  Waters never came.  It was now almost 8:36 and we had nothing infront of us but our menus finally she came back and asked if we were ready to order, I really wanted to try a mix drink. I picked two and asked her id she had tried either, she picked her favorite. He ordered a burger and coke, I ordered a vodka drink and half boneless wings. And now we wait.. And wait...   What seemed like too long. She came back with his coke and a water for me, told me my drink was being made, that she'd be right back with it.  9pm the rude interrupting manager, hastily brings us our food (still no drink) we had no silverware or napkins.  The server comes soon after to tell me that there is no vodka to make my drink and if I'd like something else.  No thanks. Just napkins. Refills. A box for the wings and a Togo container of ranch. 9:48 She brought back lids for the drop of ranch i had left and the check. I never got a water refill. We are never coming here again.
I love the food here and the server's are very nice. The whiskey river burger is the best.

Back for the free birthday burger--the one with Swiss cheese and sauteed 'shrooms.  It was delicious and cooked exactly the way I asked--medium.  The service was fine; no problems there; however, I took one star off for the following: -  Bench seats had crumbs on them -  They were rather stingy on the fries (actually, that may be a good thing) -  I guess they're conserving napkins 'cause they only give you one unless you ask -  Given the messiness of the burgers you would expect one of those little packages of moist towelettes but no -  I wish I'd remembered to ask for a plate; I hate those baskets b/c I never want to set my burger down on top of the fries and get them all soggy so I end up holding the burger during the entire lunch

I am going to preface this with the fact that I do not eat burgers very often.  I like burgers, but it's not a favorite thing to eat.  But when I am craving a burger, this is a pretty good place to go to. They have a wide variety of burgers to choose from and you can get turkey burgers or veggie burgers too. I usually get a turkey burger with mushrooms.  Pretty good burgers and EXCELLENT fries!  The fires are endless!

I work in this mall and always want to come to this restaurant but the service is horrible, come for lunch which is an hour, I am sitting at a table for 15 no one but the host has talked to me or approached me. I can see the kitchen and basically the entire staff standing together all talking to each other! I don't mind having conversation with co-workers but when your customers are not being held that's an issue! And to top it off I wait 30 min for my meal which is bland and undercooked. Serious management issue going on at this location!

I was contacted by several of the customer service team about my negative feedback. I am happy to say that their attention to the satisfaction of their customers allowed me to give them another chance and I'm glad I did. Since, I have been back to Red Robin several times and have had a pleasant and delicious experience every time!
One word. Blughyuck! Lousy food. Lousy service. One napkin for the entire meal per person. So take your own if you wish to try, at your own risk.

VERY DISAPPOINTED With Customer Service. This review is a little late since the incident happen a month ago, but anyway.  I am Gluten Free (GF) - not by choice, unless I choose to be sick.   This review only applies to the REDONDO BEACH LOCATION - I have never had an issue with the Lake Forest, CA or  Hillsboro, OR (the two I visit most often) or the other locations I have gone to in the past years. I was working on a small project in the South Bay and the producer said I could order food from a place of my choosing since the restaurant they ordered from was not GF Friendly.  I choose Red Robin, I have been to several Red Robins in different cities and states and was always happy with the service I received - especially the fries. So I ordered a basic GF Bun (as listed on the menu) with a standard hamburger.  The hostess taking the order with GF Bun and GF Fries saying there was no issue with fulfillment.  Of course they had a contact number if anything needed to be questioned or revised.    So the very kind, and extremely busy, Producer's Assistant goes to the RED ROBIN GOURMET BURGERS in REDONDO BEACH and finds out there are no Gluten Free buns as originally promised and they do not have any Gluten Free fries.  -  So they could not fulfill the requested order. I completely understand that they run out, but that is the whole point of giving your phone number so they can contact you to let you know of changes - not when you show up and 20-30 minutes when the order is suppose to be ready.   Well the Order was not ready and they were waiting for the customer to revise.  If I had been informed sooner,  I might have changed my order to something easier.  Just like when you order dining in, the waiter or waitress comes by and lets you know within minutes of the order being placed if there is a problem. The Assistant made the best call - since they did not know what items they had in stock she got me a lettuce wrap and a side salad, which granted was healthier but not as enjoyable.  As most GF people know salad tend to be the safest order at most restaurants... but I am kinda sick of Salad as the only option.

This is becoming our go-to, family restaurant.  Our approximately four visits here have all been great.  It's tends to be crowded, which is a good sign, but the wait can be a bit long.  Once they seat you, the service is excellent, and the food very good.  We love the southwestern chicken salad, and the burgers are great as well.  Very kid-friendly restaurant, and I like that they have sports on TV while you're waiting to be served.

Food was great, especially the blue cheese burger.  The food is a 4+, but. Rated them low because of our server.  The service was lousy.  I plan on giving this particular restaurant another chance--however I will make sure that I don't get the same server.  She was decent at her job.  The problem tho: after taking our order, she took another order for a party next to us that came in quite awhile after us, then went to a 3rd table and chit-chatted with them for over 3 mins.  She hadn't left our area, and therefore hadn't turned in our order.   I eventually interrupted her, and asked that she turn in our order, especially since we were starving. Unfortunately for her, this poor service resulted in her getting a lousy tip.  I'm one to tip 20% and more, but her flirtaceousness (with the other customer) ruined today's experience for me.  I hope she got a good date out of it!

10 minutes to sit and we were the only people waiting for a table, can't belive they take so long. Them ask for a table out side, and they told us that would take longer time to attend us if we want it ouside.  Bad service! So dissanpointed,  we went there for a Birthday Celebration.  :( We decided to go and have dinner at another place!

Burger #213: The Un-Yum Surprise surprise, this was my first Red Robin trip, but I knew exactly what I would be getting and I didn't expect anything more. In theory it's a great idea, lots and lots of fancy sounding burgers with a full gambit of toppings. Sadly, Red Robin is a huge chain and failed to deliver quality.  Trying to be health conscience, I ordered the A-1 Peppercorn Burger. With only 1029 calories, 59 grams of fat, 2042mg of salt, and endless fries, I should have ordered two of them, but decided one was enough.  Surprisingly the burger didn't look half bad. Too bad the good times ended there. The meat was ground way too fine and packed way too tight. This amounted to a dry and chewy burger that didn't have much beefy taste. To further spoil the burger the default bun for the peppercorn burger was an abomination of bread that diverted all possible meaty enjoyment to the off-putting flavor profile that it brought.  On a positive note, the wife's ribs and mac and cheese were pretty good!

One word: DISAPPOINTING!  It's been ages since I've eaten at Red Robin and I happened to crave a burger and I live right by it..so why not? I ordered a Buzallo Style Tavern Double, my friends ordered Cantina Jack Style Tavern Double and Burnin' Love.  Being the kind of girl who loves juicy burgers with some pink so I asked for it  to be medium; in fact we all ordered medium. Well, mine came out well-done!! They brought another one and it was a little better but not juicy or pink. The tavern doubles had really thin meat patties and the Burnin' Love was okay--it came out really pink--medium rare! The flavors weren't so bad but the patties felt like it came from a fast food joint. On top of that the service was only subpar. We had to wave several times to get her attention.  Lately, with the rise of so many burger joints, Red Robin does not even compare.  Sorry, you used to be good but you don't meet my expectations anymore.

This location has gone downhill over the past few years. At one time they removed their spinach and artichoke dip from the menu - then when it returned, it was NOT the same. They also got rid of the "Just In Quesadilla." More recent visits have garnered dry burgers with scant toppings, enough bread in the bun to feed an army for a week, and "blah" french fries. Tonight - well, tonight was the end for me. Our server Liz was top notch. Every table in her section was filled but she made us feel like we were her top priority. She easily answered my questions about certain menu items, did not pressure us to order too quickly, and was generally attentive. Appetizer came, one of the three appetizer plates was very dirty, with visible dried food stuck on it. Ditto for one of the glasses of water. Ew. Easily rectified though. There were three of us in my party. My two companions ordered the clucks & fries, and the clucks & shrimp. Both of those meals were just ok - dry chicken and a lettuce leaf garnish that was so huge and wet it had to be removed immediately to prevent soggy french fries.  I ordered the macaroni and cheese as a side dish, and it was actually very good. I also ordered the boneless Whiskey River chicken wings, which are on a separate menu and I think are a limited time item. These are served with the onion strings and home made potato chips. The first piece I tried seemed to be mostly fat, so I did not think much of it and set it aside. The second piece was fairly large, so I attempted to cut it apart with my fork. I was about to give up and ask for a knife when I noticed WHY it would not cut - IT WAS RAW. Not just a little, and not just a small portion - RAW ALL THE WAY THROUGH, as in NOT COOKED and PINK. It just so happened that Liz and another lady who I presume was possibly the manager arrived at the same time to ask if everything was ok, and I passed my plate over and discreetly let them know what the problem was. They were both very kind and apologetic, and said they would speak with the kitchen staff. Several times they offered to re-do it or replace the item but I declined. I only requested they remove the boneless wings from my bill; the end result was a much larger discount and adjustment. For that, I have to say the customer service was excellent.  Unfortunately, the negative experience with dirty dishes and undercooked food will prevent me from returning for a very long time, if ever.

Reviewers who call this a fantastic burger really need to get out a little more. I guess they've never been to Father's Office, Umami, or Plan Check. Or how about even a Hillstone Group restaurant like Houston's... Red Robin is a mediocre chain restaurant burger. I'll eat there occasionally because the kids like it and we're lazy when already at the mall. The bottomless fries are a nice except it's really unhealthy to binge on them - but again, you're not exactly health (or taste) concious if you love Red Robin...

Can't even rate this place. They told us 20 min wait. We came back in 25 min. They told us 20 min. They were very rude I might add. We love Red Robin but won't be back to this one!  We had a wonderful dinner at Calif Pizza Kitchen, right accross the way '

This is by far the only location where it takes 40-50 mins to receive an order of three "burgers." I've been here twice, and both times, the wait is ridiculously long and the waiters are incompetent. If this restaurant was cooking steaks or 5 star Italian with a crowded area, I'd understand. But, it's burgers and fries. It doesn't take almost an hour to deliver the most basic American dish. And on top of this, people who came in after us received their food 20 mins before ours. This occurred TWICE. The waiter, Mauricio, wrote my order wrong and then blamed me for the mistake. I told him, specifically, what I wanted while pointing to the item on the menu. He also forgot an onion soup that we explicitly ordered and never returned our refills. BUT he blamed me/us? This waiter is clearly forgetful and needs to work elsewhere.   I asked the manager, "Why does it take so long?" She attempted to explain using the current occupancy, which couldn't have caused 50 mins of waiting with so many empty seats available, and concluded that a chicken sandwich took longer to make. But, after I told the waiter to correct my order at the kitchen, it took less than 4 mins, not 40 mins. Then she spoke to us like we made the mistakes, yet our water, two lemonades, and onion soup still hadn't came. We requested those items 10 minutes beforehand.   This place is ridiculous. I'll never return.

Gross Gross and Gross. I came here on Saturday & they weren't very crowded. We were seated right away but had to get up about 10 minutes later to ask someone to bring us some water. Once our server finally arrived, we were overjoyed. However, the service was slow, less than mediocre and the food was disgusting (I had the Baja shrimp tacos).  The only thing that was tasty and worthwhile was the Bottomless Strawberry Lemonade -- it was sooo delicious but I had to keep asking for refills which was pretty annoying. The server wouldnt even take trash off the table until we asked her. AWFUL! UGH, I wont be eating here again. But I'll take a lemonade TO-GO though!
We used to eat here a lot. Service and food was good back then. Now, service is terrible (servers are young and have attitude) and food is mediocre. Will not be going back any time soon!
I ordered a royal red robin burger with no lettuce and no tomato...it was placed on a dirty plate with some old lettuce stuck on it..YUK!!!! Do they wash their dishes????? I was totally disgusted!
Best bartender in the south bay since it opened and great staff and great burgers and salads

This red Robin is good but not as good as the other one at Lakewood mall. The only reason why is because the waiters here aren't as nice as the one's over there. Lakewood red Robin delivers the best customer service that I ever received. The food taste the same so no complaint about that.

This is a good place to eat if you like chains. The wait has never been very long and the service has been consistently good. The menu has all sorts of food on it from hamburgers to wraps and there is an extensive list of drinks to choose from. They also have endless fries. I did find it a bit pricey for what it was.  One time, they messed up my order when I asked for no mayonnaise on my burger and instead of going back and just giving me a new bun, they just made me a new burger and told me I could take the first one home on them! That is what you call service!

I'm a big fan of a messy, juicy burger with a lot of stuff on it - so I could hardly wait to cash in my gift certificate for a free birthday burger from Red Robin!  I had never been here but my parents and sister love the bottomless fries (ironically called bottomless, considering that's directly where they're going!) and bf has had the burgers before. When we walked in, the place had a TGI Fridays feel to it.  The Olympics were on in the bar area, and there was a young-ish Friday night crowd there.  Our waitress took our orders and the food came up fast. My Royal Red Robin Burger looked great - bacon and cheddar (instead of American), tomato, and a big fried egg on top - yum!  Bf got the lettuce wrapped Whiskey River BBQ Burger and a salad with oil and vinegar (his order was a result of post-cupcake carb guilt).  I got the seasoned steak fries and he got a side salad with oil and vinegar (he had a LOT of post-cupcake carb guilt). The burgers were yummy, but maybe we shouldn't have taken a look at the calorie count chart that they put on all the tables.  My burger was 1,191 calories with 2,090 mg sodium, 83 grams of fat and 48 grams of carbs!!  Holy what???!!!  The fries added 434 calories with 444 more grams of sodium, 18 grams of fat and 60 grams of carbs! Suddenly I felt like I should never come back here ever again.  So though the service was good and the food tasted yummy, the numbers hidden in our food made it really clear that unless we have a death wish, we should really eat somewhere else.   : (  sad.

Not gonna lie. Things started very, very roughly. Came for dinner after a long day, hungry and ready to grub. Took the server a long time to approach the table. 20+ mins. We were initially approached for drinks by the bus-boy. Indicative of good team work, at least. Server finally came. We were ready and ordered our app and meal at once. Appetizer came within an appropriate length of time. Food tho, well...that showed up about a half-hour after we finished our appetizer. And of course, it was cold. Considering we'd both ordered vegan patties....this was ridiculous. When the waitress returned, I voiced my frustration. She immediately offered to make me another but I was starved, I told her not to worry about it. I'd eat the one she served. The vegan patty was bland but no big deal, that's what you get when you order vegan at a burger joint. So there I sat, eating my cold, bland vegan burger - conjuring up a scathing review when she appeared. Stephanie (the waitress) had brought me a freshly made burger. "Even though you said not to, I had them make you a fresh one anyway" she said. "I've also taken care of both your burgers". "I'm sorry for delay in your meals [she inserted an excuse about a computer failure here], I hope you'll at least take this one home with you". It was as if she'd simultaneously given me warm hug and slapped the negative review right out of my head.  I was impressed. And grateful at the effort she'd made. It reminded me that outstanding customer service - even when so much has gone wrong - can always win someone back. Although I won't be back for the amazing vegan burger, I will be back, and RR can thank Stephanie for that. And it also speaks highly of a company where their employees have been trained to make customer satisfaction (within reason) a priority. Thanks Steph.
Only had so-so service when we ate there about 2 weeks ago.  The food was good and I hate parking at the mall (OK, I hate malls....) but it's good for what it is.

I've been coming to this location most of my life and I've always had a great experience. This is the first time that I've ordered to go and I must say, Janettee is the most wonderful server I've ever had the privilege to be served by! She is the most sweetest lady on this planet! If you ever plan to make a to go order from this location, ask for Janettee. Thank you so much Janettee!
If you're looking for burgers, you gotta try this place out. Also, I love the bottomless fries and the campfire sauce.

Not like any other Red Robin I've ever been to. Definitely the least impressive I've ever been in. Don't go out of your way to eat here. The only way I'll ever go back is if I just happen to be shopping in the mall where they're located.

I've been craving a good restaurant burger, not be confused with a house burger ( which is the $hit, if you know what your doing), nor is it to be confused with a fast food burger, and a burger stand burger is different as well. Those who are serious about their food know these things about the art of treating your taste buds....( back to the review)  Red Robin has bottomless french fries and how can you not love that option...( I always order without salt, you can control your intake yourself) . I ordered the Gourmet burger on a whole grain wheat bun, grilled onions and sharp cheddar cheese and all I have to say is I'm sooooo pleased and I'm salivating thinking about the other half of my burger that I'm going to consume as soon as I finish this...  Someone else ordered the grilled Turkey burger and it looked really good and juicy....I can't really describe her order because I was so focused on the menu that offers a diverse selection....so I'm sorry for missing those details...the other person ordered the Royal burger with egg....OMG....you do need to specify what type of cheese you want if you don't care for American sliced (processed) cheese...that was the only downside to the Royal burger, but she said that she loved her burger outside of forgetting to change the cheese....  While we waited for our food our server brought out 2 baskets of fries .....how can I say glutenous ?  This is the place to get a good RESTAURANT burger and decent service. BTW, if you join the e-birthday club you will get a free burger on your birthday, not bad ....

Moe gets so excited when you order his million-dollar birthday fries, he just has to celebrate. Best steak fries. And with a view. I'm in a booth, overshadowed by the Statue of Liberty. Steak fries are unlimited and actually overshadow the burger, though the burger ain't half bad. Waitaminnit! The Statue of Liberty is holding a hamburger. Oh America, how I love thee. And your burgers. Open late weeknights, till about 10pm, this is a good place for a late night burger in a cheerful, bright family friendly environment. Usually not crowded after 9pm, plenty of booths and tables and the Lakers game on screens near the bar. I've had many of their burgers and they're all decent, but really, my favorite fries are steak fries, and they do 'em salty, crispy on the outside and delectably creamy potato on the inside. They're perfect.  I'd give the fries alone 5 stars. I've been disappointed in a salad here, and the fish and chips are okay. I've had a salmon burger and it was not bad for a fish burger. If you want consistency, stick with the burgers. Service is generally good, and your sodie won't ever be too cold that it makes your teef hurt.

I came here for the first time over the summer... honestly not much to say (both in a good and bad way). The fries & seasoning are pretty good! The burgers are mediocre, but still on the good side. I tried the blue cheese burger there (I get blue cheese burgers wherever) - a bit expensive for a burger, but if you're looking to try something new, this might be a good spot.
NO MORE SALMON & CHIPS!!! My favorite thing on the menu :(

I came here before I went to see the movie The Hangover.  It was packed for some reason but we got a table right away. I ordered the Gardenburger which was good but my son's hamburger was a bit overcooked. The service was great as well as the drinks. OT...The Hangover has to be the funniest movie I have ever seen in my life...especially if you have ever been to Vegas.  I feel I must clarify that I wouldn't take a child to see The Hangover and you shouldn't!   My son will be 18 shortly. Located in lower level of South Bay Galleria.

Love this place!  I eat here every couple of months and let me tell you, the service is excellent and very speedy.  Never much of a wait, either.  The food is delish and you can't go wrong with anything on their menu.  My favorite is their chicken burger.  No one else on Earth makes it as good as Red Robin.  If you're in the mood for just dessert, this place is perfect.  Super tasty cocktails, too!   They also have a birthday club.  Sign up online and receive a coupon for a free burger/entree every year.  Can't beat that!

I work in the Foodservice industry selling food to restaurants and let me start by saying - Red Robin uses high quality food ingredients.... I am a BURGER fanatic and the Bleu Cheese Burger is awesome! I had the double meat.....and I assure you....they use good quality fresh beef.....and the bottomless steak fries....delicious.,.. One of the best burgers ever for me.....and I eat 2-3 burgers at DIFFERENT restaurants every week! You will see!

Sara and Billy took me to this place one evening.  I got a burger and enjoyed the endless fries.   I didn't return for a long time. I got stood up here one night, but I'm not going to relive that now.   I've had the fish and chips.  It was fine.  Nothing special, but a step up from fish and chips from places like Jack in the Box.   I loved their clam chowder, however.  I spike it with Tabasco.   They have good iced tea.   I don't like their seating arrangements, however.  I don't care for the platform seating they have in the center.    Also, they have seating alongside the mall entrance, so you'll get a lot of people staring at you.   Relatively cheap.  Kinda loud inside.  Service ain't bad.

Love the Food and the service.  Come and see Jake the best bartender you'll meet.  The riblets and mac n cheese is yummy.  I really love the garlic fries and sweet potato fries.  Been coming here for years!

I walked in and was immediately greeted by friendly and helpful hostess. The food is good but we had a horrible server. Maria had a bad attitude from the very beginning. It was obvious that she did not want to be there. If I ever go back there, I'm going to make sure she isn't my server again.

I enjoy the nachos off the appetizer section of the menu. The food is tasty, I love that their fries are bottomless. They're delicious! Average food, average service. Nothing special, but nothing bad.
This was my first time going to a Red Robin restaurant, absolutely enjoyed the food and drinks.

They treated my son like cramp, the waitress (jasmine) didn't have any customer service skills. It was my sons birthday and they didn't want to sing to him, didn't bring out the bday sundae. Waitress rolled her eyes when my son asked, "why can't u guys sing happy birthday like u always do". She should be fired!!!!
I asked not to sit at the bar.  So, after a 10-15 minute wait I was seated... at the bar!  Root bear is flat....bad start already!

I live within walking distance. I have been there a handful of times. Never really thought about why, since the day they opened, I could count one one hand the times I had been there. I was visiting my girlfriend in IN and we went to one. It was great. I said, "when I get home, I will have to do a review of the one there. I can use to do a positive chain restaurant review."  As others have stated, there are a lot of unruly children and the staff is not too quick about picking up dirty flatware. I guess the secret is to order a cheeseburger and onion rings and get it to go. If you want to read a longer version of the experience, you can see it at
haven't been here in years, not a convenient location for me but do enjoy the food.  Had the Whiskey Burger which was very yummy.  Good service so when I find myself back in the area I will stop in.

I wish I could give no stars. Terrible service yet again. Shame on me for wanting the delicious food they serve. But the last few times I've had to ask myself if the food was worth sitting through being ignored by the wait staff.

Ok it was the 2nd time we ate at this place. Once on the weekend and then on a mid week weekday, both times the service was not good. The bottemless French fries weren't we got cut off after one refill, or the server just stopped coming to our table. We figured any place can have a off night, so we gave it another try, this was a mistake. The order was messed up, and we had 40 min wait for our food and the place wasn't that busy and some items didn't show up and it seem the sever was hiding from us when we tried to pay the bill. Next time we will go to the Burger City Grill in Lomita or In-and-out in Torrence

I used to get lunch from here, not anymore. What is up with the new "healthy" menu? They took out chili!? what?! i know there were fattening things on there, but come on, i can also choose to do extra cardio.  :(

I came with a friend and I think this place is not really an experience for friends. I think this place is for lovers or date. for the type of food I got. I could have gone somewhere much cheaper and enjoyed myself more. It was a good experience so I can say I have done it. I will say that the cheese appetizer was the best part. Say I was walking out I realized they have a happy hours that was really reasonable with the cheese fondue. I will come back for that.

I got a free birthday burger, so I came here by myself during lunch.  I ordered the prime rib dip, which came with garlic parmesan steak fries.  The prime rib dip was ok, but it was too big for me that I ended up just eating the meat without the bread.   The garlic parmesan steak fries, however, were possibly the BEST fries I have ever tasted in my entire life!  I ate every single fry.  I actually preferred the fries over the prime rib dip.  I liked the fries so much that I ordered them for take-out the following week.  It only cost me about $2 for a pretty big serving of fries that I split with someone.  SO good.  I'm so glad I don't live near a Red Robin's, or I will, without a doubt, become obese.

I haven't been to Red Robin in a MINUTE.  I mean like a good decade or so.  I remembered them for their great burgers and strawberry lemonade. I guess that's what I should have ordered!  Instead I came here with my girlfriend and tried something new; Riblets & Clucks or whatever the eff it's called (riblets and chicken basically).  It was okay.  The portions were SUPER small for the price ($13.99!) and I was disappointed as I could have gotten better food for a better value at Chili's or Islands.  The only reason I'm giving this place any stars is because our waiter was great.  Super attentive and nice and checked on us often.  I gave him a good tip because he deserved it, but I wish my bill had been half the price.  I probably wouldn't come here again. This is not the Red Robin that I remembered.

I've been here for their burgers which are great, but today I came for happy hour which sucks. I needed to find somewhere nearby to kill some time for happy hour looked online and found red Robin. The review said a great drink specials and awesome appetizers starting at three dollars. Well they have one appetizer at three dollars and the rest are 5, 7 and 9 (There are only a handful total) and none of them are very good. I know other food specials for happy hour at all! I'm disappointed when I come here again for happy hour! Still haven't found anything to beat elephant bar!

We had great service but there was a problem with a chicken sandwich that we ordered. I notice that my Son took 1 bite and that was it I asked him what's wrong he said it taste like fish so I tried it and sure enough it taste like fish. The Waitress was very nice and removed it from my bill and the Manager came and also spoke to us they were all really nice but this was our 1st time at Red Robin and I think it will be our last it was pretty gross..........

If you've been to Red Robin before then you know what they're about.  Great burgers and bottomless steak cut fries.  I've been to this location twice during lunch with a couple of coworkers.  The first time the service was okay, nothing to complain or cheer about.  Today we were helped by "E.J" and it was fantastic service.  He was really nice and constantly made sure that everything was going good.  No mistakes with the order and never had to ask him for a refill.  He pretty much kept his eyes on the glasses and filled them up when they were at "dangerously" low levels haha.  You can't really go wrong with any of the burgers, and when you add a fried egg on top it is tres magnafic.  Me and the gang will definitely be stopping by for future lunches.  Keep up the good work.  Red Robin....YYYYYUUUUUMMMM!!!!

This is my usual Red Robin location - it's never too crowded so it's great! I've never really had any problem with food/staff/parking here. I usually like to get Banzai Burger - with pineapple and BBQ sauce in my burger with unlimited fries! I've had their wraps in the past. They are really really yummy, too!

I used to love Red Robin but the last 3 times I've come I was very disappointed in the quality of my meal tried the riblets they were overcooked and dry, tried the chili burger and it was the worst, last night I got a burger so dry and burnt around the edges I left it there and each time I've left over half my meal and told the servers it was subpar and they just kinda stared at me. So last night is the last dime red robin gets from me I can get a burger anywhere.

As always I belly up here.  Service seems on again off again at seated tables.  I am a burger junkie and for a chain these are damn good.  The perfect size not too huge where you strain eating them.  Almost backyard burger size.  I usually stick with the same couple of burgers - bacon and cheese and the blue ribbon.  The spinach artichoke dip with the buttery garlicky pita triangles rock too.  I also pretty much sprinkle that red robin seasoning on everything...yummmy. cold beer fast service at the bar and good solid burgers...win win for me!  Oh and do your self a favor AVOID THE NUTRITIONAL CHART AT THE TABLE.....Avert your eyes...trust me!

Ate at Red Robin and the service was great but I ordered the Clucks (chicken nuggets) and Fries and the clucks had a weird taste.  I'm not sure if the oil was old or what but it had a really weird after taste.

Unlimited Fat Fries hot crispy seasoned fat effing fries SHOULD I CONTINUE? Ok so I had a guacamole bacon burger cuz I believe it will be what they will serve in hell with my favorite beers on tap. Can you believe my girl had a soup and half a turkey sandwich WTF!!! Such a waste. I am hoping to try the onion tower when I go back. Yeah I will be going back. Im a fat ass who loves burgers, I can live with that!!!

I've been here plenty of times.  I had to review this today because it just so happened that I ate here for lunch... and dinner.  Yes, I know.  I'm such a pig. Let's start with lunch... I had the peppercorn burger which is always good.  Their burgers have never really disappointed me.  In the past, I've had their whiskey river bbq burger and their royal red robin burger.  Both equally satisfying.  Maybe the Royal burger is better just for the fact that it has a jumbo fried egg!  Personally, I prefer skinny fries but how can you go wrong with bottomless steak fries!  I usually ask for a side of their onion ring sauce for the fries... tasty! On to dinner...  I felt so guilty for coming again that I decided to stray away from the burgers.  Instead I had the clam chowder soup and caeser salad.  The salad was decent but I absolutely loved the soup!  It's so much more creamy than others.  Very pleasantly surprised that there were a lot of clams, too!   So I had one of my friend's steak sliders, too.  Really good.  What really got me were the garlic parmesan steak fries.  Hell yeah.  I thought I was going to burst.  I seriously could not stop eating them.  Just thinking about them right now makes me want more! This Tuesday night must have been special because that was the first time I ever saw the Red Robin mascot greeting customers at their tables.  My companions have said they've seen the mascot before but not I!  =)  Mike, the manager, took the time to come to our table and check to see if everything was okay.  We voiced some concerns about past problems.  I told him that I loved Red Robin so much I had to come back for dinner... maybe I should show up for breakfast tomorrow?

I used to come here all the time when I was younger! My friends and I would eat here at the beginning or end of a fun shopping day at the mall. I remember really loving this place! But sadly, with age, this place has lost its sparkle.  Their burgers are okay.. maybe a little overrated. They have a wide selection though and they come with bottomless fries. But I don't particularly like their fries because they're the fat soft kind, not the thin crispy ones!  But what's good is their seasoning! They have a bottle of their seasoning on each table so you can sprinkle more onto your food! It adds a nice little kick! Now when I go, I usually get their crispy chicken tender salad ($9.99) which comes with fried chicken breast tenders, hard-boiled egg, tomatoes, cheddar cheese and tiny bits of bacon. You can get any dressing you want with it but I'd definitely recommend the poppyseed honey mustard! MMM I looove honey mustard! The salad also comes with two small pieces of pita-like bread with garlic on it. Portions are pretty big too! I can never finish the salad! But one thing I will always love is their freckled lemonade, which is their strawberry lemonade but it's not the fake powdery kind (or maybe partially it is?). It has actual strawberries in it (or what used to be actual strawberries... haha). Basically, what I'm getting at is you can see the black strawberry seeds swimming in your lemonade, hence "freckled!" Makes it seem more authentic, like you're in the countryside sitting in your rocking chair on the porch, watching your father feed the horses... Service is kinda quick but less than friendly. It's located right in front of the South Bay Galleria mall next to Nordstrom and CPK so you can park in the lot in front or in the structure, or valet if you're a baller!

Brianna T was one of the nicest people we have ordered with. We ordered to go since the restaurant wait was 45 minutes. She was prompt and delightful and got our order perfect. We had the extra ranch and burgers just the way we like it. Because of her, we order to go since she has not yet been promoted to server. We hope she gets considered soon so we can dine in! She is an excellent asset to your establishment.

for 10 bux you'll get a well cooked, fresh tasting burger and endless, hot steak fries.  that's a pretty solid deal in my book.  the meat was cooked perfectly, pink all the way through.  is it the best tasting burger?  not by a long shot.  meat is a little bland, the bun fell apart way too early in the chow down experience.  but again, this is Red Robin and it's $10 and some change.  service started off slow but picked up nicely, as our food came out quickly.  they were also very accommodating of our son and his stroller, which basically doubles as his eating chair w/ his snack tray attached.  and i can't get enough of that seasoning salt!  yum!!  you know the second ingredient in that stuff is sugar?  yep.  more delicious hidden calories!

Came here with 3 people said 15 min but they kept seating everyone that came after us! Host says oh we only have tables of two are you kidding like i have to wait forever while u sit 6 parties that came after worse customer service ever this place sucks! I will never come to this location ever
Great place to eat. I love going here on the weekends. The service is bad at times but still good food.

Well to summarize.. it was the worst service we ever had. It wasn't too busy but our waitress was just really slow and seemed like she just really didn't want to be there. To the point, I ordered a medium rare burger with an onion bun and specifically told her that I was allergic to sesame seeds and couldn't eat the regular bun. When she brought the food, it had a regular sesame bun but before I could say anything she walked away.. We didn't see her again for almost 15 mins. I let her know I couldn't eat it, without even saying sorry, she took it to get me another one. 20 mins later, everyone is done eating and she said it's still going to be a few more minutes. Again no apologies.. finally my food gets there and it's almost burnt but it has the good bun so I just eat it. Not to mention after all this time, she wasnt even refilling our drinks. At this point I am actually expecting a discount because of how horrible it was. She could have even not charged me for my garlic aolli and I would have been satisfied. (Btw, charging for sauces when people are ordering a bunch of food anyway is ridiculous.. how much does that really cost you? ..for another time.) We may go back, we may not.. but if we do, have it together.. Allergies are a serious matter and customers shouldn't wait over 30 mins for a burger that you messed up on.
Every time i come here the service is great and the burgers are incredible. It is a freindly environment and we come here at least once a week. keep up the great work.
Red Robin still holds the same great service I remember when I was a kid. Miss being here. I miss the food and now I get to have a wonderful lunch date with my wonderful boyfriend.

I've been to this place plenty of times When I come to the galleria mall and most of the time I get good service and good food, this review is based on the service. For some reason it was toooo slow and it wasn't that busy. Pick up the service, not sure if it was the waiters or just short staff.

Some love it, some think it cheesy... Me I think I'm hooked on the nostalgia. I've been coming here with family for years. Its great for groups and has a great bar. This one is in the South Bay Galleria. Though the mall has changed many times and is constantly changing, this place has been a staple throughout my childhood. I love their bottomless fries and delicious strawberry lemonades.  I'm not the type to shop at the mall only to end the day with a big meal. If you treat this place like a seperate restaurant I think you'll enjoy it mall. If you see it as part of the mall, I don't see it as great. Not really sure why. But if you want burgers, drinks, fries, and dessert this is a great place.

Red Robin is my favorite chain restaurant, narrowly beating out Outback Steakhouse. The burgers are huge, juicy and savory. The special seasoning at the tables is so amazing that I frequently remove the cap and just inhale deeply. The thick-cut steak fries are delicious and, of course, come with unlimited free refills. They even bring out orders of fries for the table before the meal comes, like Mexican restaurants do for chips. The root beer floats are sweet and fizzy and, like the fries, are bottomless. Word of advice: come here with an appetite. They never stop bringing you seconds and you need two or three refills of everything to really appreciate the experience. For dessert, I recommend the Towering Doh! Rings...miniature croissant/doughnuts all stacked on a giant wooden peg. Soft, sugary, and served fresh from the oven, it's pretty hard to stop eating them. A typical meal for two can run $30-40, a great value for the portions and quality. Everything I've said above could apply to the entire chain, but this location at the South Bay Galleria is great unto itself. There's nothing I enjoy more than coming here after watching a movie at the AMC on the other side of the mall. It's nice and clean, frequently crowded but never too loud. The waitstaff are friendly and helpful, and do everything they can to keep you eating, like the stereotypical grandmother always commenting that her grandchildren are skin and bones. To sum up: the chain has great food in great quantities at great prices, and this particular one has a great location with great service. Yummm. Been here three times so far, and can't wait to go again.

Santa Fe chicken salad ... Chicken hard as a rock! Skimpy on chicken, Manager not helpful. However Khai our waiter VERY kind prompt & did all he could (within his power) to make our experience as good as it could be ... Did enjoy my Salad after waiting for the 2nd one!!!

Came in at around 2 o'clock & I didn't get my food until 244pm. The restaurant wasn't that busy at all so I didn't understand the wait time. When the food finally arrived the fries were lukewarm. The best thing about the meal was the Freckled Lemonade. We had a busy waitress. I guess they were understaffed today.
I was severed a plate with hair on it !!!! I felt so sick . I showed the manager and he offered a new plate. Oh a plate without hair?  I will never go back.

Stay away from this place!! They violate Heath code by serving you food on dirty dishes! This is just disgusting!!When reported to the female manager on duty, she copped an attitude and offered no solution.. First and last time I come here.

This is an awesome burger restaurant. Not only do you get the option to have your meat as you want it, but there's a variety of buns to choose from. If that wasn't all, the fries are bottomless. I suggest eating them with some campfire sauce; which is a modified version of barbeque sauce. Lastly, the service was relatively average so I got nothing to complain about here.

Not good. Everything here was sub-par (well, the hostess and some waitresses were nice). We came here, a group of six of us, adults and kids. The food was not good. I had the 'grilled salmon burger'. Salmon was a bit dry, not enough flavor in the mustard condiment. The side salad was not great, either (romaine, croutons, tomato, all flavorless) and the dressing sucked (bland, oily). I sampled some of the other food. No one really thought it was very good. My 7-year old nephew who is not picky did not like his spaghetti. It was too mushy (think 'Chef Boyardee' out of the can -- ever heard of al dente, guys?). It arrived w/fruit; my sister reminded the server we had asked for fries with it. Fries never came. The 'buzzard wings' were bland. I don't like ranch nor bleu cheese, but had him bring some for others just in case. It was GROSS. The bleu cheese-thing kept literally swelling in its rammekin throughout the meal (pic posted here).  AIEESSHHHH!!

Chose Red Robbins tonight for dinner and was disappointed as soon as we sat at Liz' station (of 4 tables)...  waited about 10 min. Get waitress to come to our table. Another 10 min to get my Strawberry Lemonade and water and a little longer for my daughter's chocolate shake....  another 10 min or so for our soup... then followed bu our main entree.  Thank goodness the food was good. When we finished, I flagged the manager Ivan and told him our issues.  I guess they were overwhelmed but ir seems like our server was nowhere to be found.   :-(   even after all that, we still tipped but only 15% bec. of the bad service..... Maybe next time???

Have not been here in years since I have moved.  I will not be back that is fer sure.  Alot of changes can not say they where good. Strange kiosk on the table and our waiter comes by and says to order the app on the kiosk and he will be backl for our dringks and order.  Why not do the whole thing--odd. Then he comes back takes the order and lives.  It took awhile for the food. When it does coem out the fries are cold.  The chk tenders 4 and fries for 10.49 too much and not worth it.  Then after we are finished and are waiting on the check he finally comes over and says are you waiting on me or paying by kiosk.  Doesn't explain the kiosk just takes off. We tried paying by kiosk but if you do not understand it and make a mistake it jams and you are unable to pay.  Got the mamnager over there and she is unable to make the change.  Then once again at her station she can not make the change and 1 person has to pay for it all. Worst expierence.  I will not be back.  doesn't even deserve the 1 star.  frustrating

Walked in April 9th, the day before my birthday, after some shopping I wanted to sit and eat. Took the hostess 5 or so minutes to come to the front to greet us, the restaurant was empty, seats outside and on right side empty and she said we had to wait until they cleaned off a table?!?!?!?! We turned around and took our money to Habit, the food and SERVICE is excellent! Red Robin is in dire need of new  management!
I have had better burgers, fries, shakes.
It's all about the burgers and the all you can eat fries.  They have one of the best seasonings for fries around and they're bottomless!

Love the plethora of choices for even non burger lovers.  There's yummy shakes, strawberry lemonade and many varieties of burgers, appetizers and desserts.  Great place to meet with friends/coworkers and family friendly.   However I don't give it 5 stars only because at my last visit, the bun of the kiddie burger I ordered for my son was dry tasting like day old bread.  Otherwise, service has always been good and I like the fact that you can request more fries, steak cut at that as often as you can ingest.
I used to come here almost every week for kiwanis meetings. I love the Strawberry lemonade to this day and the burgers are aiight.

went in on saturday 7/28/12 at about 2. was told that there was no wait in the bar area. ok. sat in the bar area with waiters walking by us and even looking at us for 10 minutes. no one gave us a menu. no one acknowledged we were there. if they said "we'll be with you in one minute" we would have stayed. we got up and walked out. probably no one even noticed. red robin, i used to frequent your establishment in oregon. I WILL NEVER RETURN. PERIOD. old guy who waiters there needs to be told "if a customer comes in and sits down and makes eye contact with you and you see they have not been waited on, don't wait 10 minutes hoping someone else will wait on them."

we came on wednesday party of 5 sat down and ate. haha well atmosphere... one freakn annoying baby... too bad servers cant do anything about it...  anyway... i forgot what most of the orders were, but i ate souper something?? its like you get to choose one from 3 wraps and one from 3 soups. i got BLTA wrap with clam chowder, and the wrap was good but clam chowder... not too great. My friend got cripsy chicken salad? with honey mustard. They said it was not bad but personally for me, it was wayyyyy too sweet. i forgot  what other 3 people got but it was like 1 wrap 2 burgers. they said it was great so i believe next time when i crave a burger i will come again :D

This place is always packed on weekends but empty on weekdays. Even with a large crowd, the wait isn't too long. The staff is always friendly and quick.  The only two things I order are the Banzai Burger and Whisky chicken wrap. And the best non-alcoholic drink is the strawberry lemonade (best I've ever had). The burger is soo juicy and huge, they make it just as I want it. Love the fact that I don't have to ask for ranch sauce for my fries, they just assume and bring it for you. The chicken wrap is just as good. I love coming with my boyfriend or tons of friends. Always a good experience. And the bottomless fries is a plus!

they need to have a staff meeting and talk about SERVICE. The food is consistantly good, the service is consistantly HORRIBLE. God forbid you get there when they have just opened, a shift change or getting ready to close in an hour. shift change?  you can actually have 10 waiters all talking at the front counter and not one can help get a drink refill.  Ugggh.
The food is okay. The service was good. The restaurant is clean. Its a nice place to go to after walking around the mall for a while especially if you have kids

I stopped by here for a quick lunch yesterday. I've never tried their burgers, although I used to always keep hearing about how good they were. So, driving down Torrance, the Red Robin sign caught my eye from the South Bay Galleria, and I decided to finally give it a shot. Interior decor reminds you of the "other places" such as TGIF, Applebee's, Chili's, etc... of the same class, but the food here is actually tasty!  I had the Bleu burger. The bun was tasty and reminded me of the finer hot dog buns I usually buy from the grocery stores. The patty was well cooked and had the texture and taste of a medium-well cooked patty, which was just what I ordered. The burger was surprisingly good, but I think the hype may have killed it for me, hence -1, however everything else was great....everything else meaning the fries. The seasoning and the fries...what a great combo! The service is great. I had a gentleman who was extremely attentive and warm and didn't hesitate to ask me if I needed anything else. Wasn't annoying, wasn't negligent. Great waiter. Anyways, if you're in a situation where you need a quick bite to eat around that area, I can safely recommend coming here.
We've had Jamie (female) twice, as our server. She is very friendly and attentive. We've never had to ask for a refill on drinks or BBQ sauce! Thanks Jamie!

Horrible horrible horrible horrible. So very disappointed in this place. I usually go to the Lakewood red robin which I awesome but this is closer to home so I decided to give it a try FOR MY BIRTHDAY!! I actually love the food at red robin, the service at this location is beyond horrible, at least when I went on Saturday night. I so wish I could actually give this zero stars. I told my husband I wanted to go to red robin to top off my birthday weekend because I had not been since last year. My how this particular one has changed in just a year. The server never refilled our lemonade, was not concerned that the food was taking forever, and didnt seem to care to even bring out our french fries to hold us over. They weren't that busy, we were seated around 8:20 and a 9:30 we still didnt have our food. We left because we were starving and disappointed. All i wanted was my Banzai burger, my one year old wanted the french fries, and my husband wanted the chili cheese burger. What was so hard Red Robin Redondo Beach? This review is a week later and I am still disappointed and disgusted.

Thanks to all those commercials on cable TV, I made the Boyfriend take me to Red Robin for dinner on Sunday.  You would think that with all the stuff they put on their burgers, they would be flavorful.  Wrong.  I ordered the Blackened Bayou Burger.  According to the menu on their site, this burger is topped with "roasted red peppers, onion, pepper jack cheese, a Creole mustard sauce, and a cabbage-carrot mix on a jalapeño-cornmeal Kaiser roll."   Maybe a little busy but sounds good, right?  All those ingredients alone are good.  They should be hella good all mashed together between a roll.  And a Kaiser roll at that!!  Too bad it was bland.    All of Red Robin's burgers come with endless steak fries.  That's kinda cool, I guess.  How much can you really eat though?  My burger weighed at least a pound on its own.  This particular location was really loud with screaming kids as well.   Bland burger.  Acting out kids.  I don't need a third reason not to come back.

Well,Bottomless Root Beer Float -- those are 4 glorious words!  That's right peeps!  An all you can eat/drink root beer floats!  And, hold on...it's only $3.19.  Are you kidding me?  The other thing I love is that it is  FAST SERVICE GOOD FOOD HOT ON THE SPOT

A reliable burger chain with a "wiiide variety" of burgers (say it with a drawl like a fat Southern sheriff for maximum effect). And if you don't like what's on the menu, you can customize it to your heart's delight. It's encouraged here, unlike other places that judge you or flat out refuse to allow substitutions or your own creations. The "bottomless" (God Bless America! and gluttony) steak fries are okay but can be inconsistent (one batch is fine and the next batch is overdone). Be sure to ask for the various dipping sauces. My favorite is the (crack-laced) buffalo sauce.  TIP: They offer both Gardenburger AND Boca burger meatless patty varieties. (To non-veggies: the choice is somewhat akin to Coke vs. Pepsi. People generally prefer one to the other). It's one of the few places that offers a choice. PS I like the fact that a bird is the spokescreature for a chain of burger joints. Kind of like how cows handle all the advertising for the Chick-Fil-A chain ("Eat more chik'n"). The war rages on in the animal kingdom!

i love their freckle lemonade! Also enjoy well-done fries. if you want some hamburgers and a sit-down restaurant, go for it. variety of hamburgers and they have other entrees too. The restaurant isn't so crowded so its good for lunch or dinner. Endless fries make me go there! Last to mention, their honey mustard is the best :)

whenever I go to places esp. Restaurants I always give it the benefit of the doubt. Not this time. The waiter gave thee worst service ever. He wasn't attentive. He just seemed kind of rude. I've gone go red robin for many years but mostly at west covina. By the way, I love that spot. But never again, will I come to this one.

Carl's Jr has the Six Dollar Burger for $4.  This leads me to think Burgers have categories.  $4 burger is McDees.  $6 Burger is the local char broiler.  Then you skip $8 and go directly to $10 burger.  This is where burgers are called gourmet.  Umami, Fathers Office, Counter, Etal are $10 burgers.  Of course, on Yelp, you give a rating based on it's rank within the category.  So a 5 star $6 burger would 2 stars if it was sold as a $10 burger.  Red Robin is trying to get into that $10 burger echelon, but they fall short.  Their burger is respectable if it was sold at Steve's, but it wouldn't make it on the Umami menu.  Today, I had the bacon burger with cheese and egg. There is a fancy schmancy name for it, but I already forgot that name.  They do ask if you want it pink or not, so they do have two levels of cooking the meat which is good.  Of course I went with pink.  Life revolves around pink things.  Pigs are pink and.... well.. you get the idea.   So, the burger was good, but not $10 good.  I would rather spend $10 on a Umami burger.

Red Robin is hands down my favorite place to get a burger. I like it better than just about any other burger you can get (and yes, that includes In & Out). I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here. . . and I've always had good service. Love their garlic fries as well! Highly recommended!
Red robin is always one of my fav restaurants to get fries and burgers.

Red Robin is located across from California Pizza Kitchen on the East entrance to the South Bay Galleria.  It is a burger place, but Red Robin has a little more sit-down touch than a Johnny Rockets.  If you are going here, stick with the burgers (a good variety offered) and fries (long, thick steak fries).  The burgers are decent--they are better here than what you would get at Johnny Rockets. In terms of their plated entrees, you are best to steer clear.  Everything I've order (that didn't come on a bun) wasn't good.  They don't offer it anymore, but once I ordered fish & chips here, where instead of cod, it was fried salmon.  That didn't really work (though I'm not sure why I thought it would).  The service is okay at best.

One of my favorite things about the Red Robin at the South Bay Galleria mall is the variety of options on their menu and the friendly service we always get there.  When you feel like a burger and ice cream shake or a healthy chicken wrap they have it all!  The staff is always quick and helpful and the managers always come around to check on their customers.  I even run in there sometimes just to grab some food to go.  It's a great restaurant for a great value!!
Vegetarians: Can get any burger with a veggie patty!  The wraps are good. Salads are huge. Staff is friendly. Bathrooms are clean.

I guess for a chain its really not that bad.  The fries are average but endless, and the strawberry lemonade is great and also endless.  Problem is all that sugar and starch will turn you into a fatty.  Fast.  I don't come here anymore because I like to fit into my pants.  It's not bad though.  I've had their burgers and chicken fingers and stuff over the years, it's edible but nothing to write home about.  Lot of better local options.  Can't beat the strawberry lemonade though.  Had a friend order a strawberry sprite one time, that was good too.
The Burgers are fantastic! Our server was okay could have been a bit nicer. But overall loved it!

I really enjoyed our late lunch served by Brooke, our waitress..she was an awesome waitress... She was always one step ahead in service like as if she read our mind..Great customer service skill and positive  attitude... Red Robin is lucky to have her..
I went with my husband for lunch and waited for 20 minutes giving them the benefit of the doubt, and still wasn't acknowledged so we walked out.

I love this place. I wish I could live here. Their botomless steak fries are why I live. My favorite burger is the Banzai Burger and if I could, I would date it and then marry it. Red Robins is hands down the place for burgers and delicious fries.

This place is awesome ... from the outside you would think it's like a glorified Denny's/Johnny Rockets but inside you see it's a burger bar ... with whole lots more!  I had the Peppercorn Burger, with the onion straws on the bottom and a side of honey mustard for the steak fries.  First of all, I love honey mustard. I could blind taste honey mustard. Seriously. That being said, I'll take the Pepsi challenge with Red Robin's honey mustard over any other chains any day. Easily, top 3.  Also, while I'm on the topic of things Red Robin is Awshm at, let me mention their strawberry-lemonades are arguably the best hybrid lemonade drinks on the planet. Yes, better than Sonic. Yes, better than your mother's. They're f'in sweet. ... shit, sorry, no pun intended. But trust me, they're great. A little pricey for lemonade, but it's worth it.  I haven't had their salads, or their wraps, but all the burgers on the menu sound great and I can't wait to go back.  Don't forget their seasoning!!! It's amazing!! Goes great on everything ... even directly on your tongue. Swear.
Can't beat the Bleu Cheese burger and endless fries! Service was good. Everyone was friendly.

Still the best burger place I've ever been too.  They have very creative burgers and bottomless fries that I always dip in ranch and honey mustard.  I don't even like honey mustard but I love theirs!  I always get the Bacon Cheeseburger..I mean seriously how can you go wrong with that? They have mini sirloin burgers with onion strings that are ok, but I would rather have it with ground beef because the sirloin is a little tough.  Overall, I love this place!

Red Robin has the best Crispy Chicken Burger I have ever tasted!  How many times have you all had a piece of chicken that tasted like fried fish or french fries because they will use the same fryer for all their food?  Not at Red Robin...also you must have their Garlic Parmesan fries instead of the regular fries - they are phenomenal! The freckled lemonade is delicious but kinda pricey.  Doesn't even matter because the burger is all you'll remember!

The burgers, chicken sandwiches, thick bottomless steak fries are great but not good enough to overcome THE HORRIBLE SERVICE.  The servers really get annoyed if they have to do any work and if you really want to get screwed then order take out because they'll get your order wrong everytime.  If you complain, the 15 year old manager on duty will offer you a half- hearted apology.  It's a shame because the food is good.  Unfortunately the poor service must be a chain thing because the other two red robins I've been to(Calabassas, and Cerritos) also had poor service.  I'd go to Islands or Chilis instead.

i got the A1 Peppercorn hamburger...it was pretty good cuz it had applesmoked bacon mmmm...and i didnt know u can order as much french fries as u want...plus the seasoning i put on my fries tasted real good specially when its super hot right off the deep fryer!

I'm partial to this place, because one of my brother's used to work here before moving on to bigger and better things. I usually like my burgers medium (some pink), and consistently they know how to get this right. Ask for your burger to be cooked by Manny or Juan; they're the shit in the kitchen. My favorites include the bbq chicken burger, the guacamole burger and the jalapeo burger. Also, get your fries without salt and they'll cook them fresh for you!
I take my sister there all the time it's great we love the food and drinks i must say they have the BEST fries they are so good and the strawberry lemonade is great =)

All I have to say is whiskey river BBQ burger with a Boca patty... bottomless fries get them crispy. Get a side of honey mustard and you are good to go. They also have the tower of onion rings and mozzarella sticks that are tasty. Take the extra fries they are free, they aren't just asking if you want extra fries so they can charge you, you can really have all the fries you want...side note not said by me if you have a brand new Red Robbin salt hey it's free... and my econ teacher said there is no free lunch...

Five star burger joint! Spirits too! Bottomless fries and domestic beer. Go for the spirits if its a drinking mood you're in. Oh, Yea, this place is in the Galleria Mall with Valet parking (as if you need it). This was a favorite of mine in Seattle too...

Yay!  I had some freckled lemonade!!  And it's with free refills!! I haven't been to Red Robin in years!!  The freckled lemonade hit the spot (strawberry and lemonade).  And the burger was very good!  I usually get the mushroom burger, but decided to try the A1 Peppercorn burger - too much onion, so I took it out.  And the bottomless steakfries.  OMG.  I haven't eaten like this in like... oh maybe yesterday.  LOL. It was definitely good comfort food!!  Must have at least 2x a year. I don't remember all the busy-ness the interior tho - the posters and music and the waitstaff with loads of pins on their suspenders (just like TGIF).

I went to another restaurant and was not hungry, but I ate. I haven't been to the Red Robin is such a long time. I ordered an chicken quesi. with side salad and my sister had chicken wings with side salad. The chicken quesi. had tomatoes, cheese, bacon and mushrooms. It tastes so good.  It was after 2pm, so the it was not crowded the food came quick and the waitress was nice. The music is a bit loud for eating, but I would go back, because it appears I may want to sample a few more things on the menu. I think if you are a big burger eater you should like the place, for me it's always going to be some chicken something dish.  I really like the frame photography on the walls, it was nice looking around at the pictures. I hope to get my photographers pictures up on the wall at a place like that soon.
I love Red Robin's burgers... one of my favorite places to eat.  The garlic Parmesan fries are extraordinary, too.
This place is okay...I have tried several things here but my favorite is the turkey club on croissant...and fries are always hot and good...We usually go with 3-4 people and most like their meals.
I love the food but I dislike the people I am surrounded by at the restaurant. Felt uncomfortable and I was seated next to a bunch of undisciplined kids. Parking sucks...because it's at the mall.

My friends and I came here after a trip to K1; we had about 12 people with us.  I was surprised that we were seated rather quickly.  Our waitress was really friendly, and was quick and prompt.  One of my friend's ordered the peach non-alcoholic specialty drink, and jokingly complained that it didn't come in the swirly glass that it was advertised to come in.  She explained that they were out of the glasses, but upon his third refill she managed to find one for him.  The burgers come with bottomless fries, and she indeed kept the fries flowing.  We tried all of the sauces you could get for your fries; honey mustard, ranch, buffalo, and bbq.  Honey mustard being my favorite. I ordered a mushrooms swiss burger, and was pleasantly surprised to find that they didn't overcook it.   All in all it was a good experience, the burgers and fries were good.  The restaurant was clean, and the wait staff was friendly and very accomidatting.  Good place to come for a burger, and expensive burger, but good burger non the less. Rock you like a hurricane

I thought I had written a review for this place before as I have eaten at the one here in Redondo and in Cerritos but I'll glady do it again. Place is great for kids and families although, I'm not wild about the fact that both locations are located in malls. Waiting for a table has never been a problem and were always seated in less than 10 minutes or less. I finally tried the Royal Red Robin that has a fried egg in it without the mayo and it was delicious!! Well, my mind loved it, my stomach was roiling afterwards both times I had it (maybe from the grease of the fried egg). However, I still liked it and would gladly go back again. Can't remember any specific dish righ offhand, but there Teriyaki burger gets rave reviews from my other friends who go there as well. Their fries are limitless (so I've been told. I've never been able to eat past my first basket of fries that come with my meal) and already crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Add a dash of their seasoned salt to the fries and they are even better even when cold. Try their strawberry lemonade. It's really good. Prices are decent, nothing outrageous. All in all, nice place to go if you want a casual atmosphere that doesn't resemble a library

It's a okay diner that just so happens to specialize in burgers. I like their burgers and the fries to me aren't that great. Their cocktails are okay as well. I'd only go there if  want something a bit more sophisticated than McDonald's.
